quote: Doubt is not a pleasant state  but certainty is a ridiculous one.
author: Voltaire

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: To be absolutely certain about something  one must know everything  or nothing  about it.
author: Olin Miller

quote: Free man is by necessity insecure  thinking man by necessity uncertain.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: We sail within a vast sphere  ever drifting in uncertainty  driven from end to end.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Something must be left to chance  nothing is sure in a sea fight.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: There is nothing certain about war except that one side won't win.
author: Sir Ian Hamilton

quote: There is only one thing about which I am certain  and this is that there is very little about which one can be certain.
author: W Somerset Maugham

quote: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: I'm often wrong  but never in doubt.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: There is one thing certain  namely  that we can have nothing certain  therefore it is not certain that we can have nothing certain.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Every area of trouble gives out a ray of hope  and the one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is certain or unchangeable.
author: John E. Kennedy

quote: Any coward can fight a battle when he's sure of winning.
author: George Eliot

quote: The demand is for certainty is a sign of weakness.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: The unknown is what it is. And to be frightened of it is what sends everybody scurrying around chasing dreams  illusions  wars  peace  love  hate  all that.... Accept that it's unknown  and it's plain sailing.
author: John Lennon

quote: Only a weak mind seeks ultimate answers.
author: Agnes Thornton

quote: When nothing is sure  everything is possible.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: He who forecasts all perils will never sail the sea.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is a time for departure  even when there's no certain place to go.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of shore for a very long time.
author: Andre Gide

quote: To teach how to live with uncertainty  yet without being paralyzed by hesitation  is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy can do.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: The successful man is he who  when he sees that no further certainty is attainable  promptly decides on the most probable side  as if he were completely sure it was right.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: Not seeing is half-believing.
author: Vita Sackville-West

quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched-they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There is no advancement to him who stands trembling because he cannot see the end from the beginning.
author: E. J. Klemme

quote: I am a woman who understands the necessity of an impulse whose goal or origin still lie beyond me.
author: Olga Broumas

quote: To end with certainty  we must begin with doubting.
author: Stanislaus

quote: Gardening is an exercise in optimism.
author: Maria Schinz

quote: In the face of uncertainty  there is nothing wrong with hope.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: No object is mysterious. The mystery is your eye.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Faith hasn't got no eyes  but she's long-legged.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Maturity of mind is the capacity to endure uncertainty.
author: John H. Finley

quote: Don't be afraid of the space between your dreams and reality. If you can dream it  you can make it so.
author: Belva Davis

quote: If a man will begin with certainties  he shall end in doubts  but if he will content to begin with doubts  he shall end in certainties.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I said here's the river I want to flow on  here's the direction I want to go  and put my boat in. I was ready for the river to take unexpected turns and present obstacles.
author: Nancy Woodhull

quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Nobody can really guarantee the future. The best we can do is size up the chances  calculate the risks involved  estimate our ability to deal with them and make our plans with confidence.
author: Henry Ford II

quote: Every time I think that I'm getting old  and gradually going to the grave  something else happens.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: Many live in dread of what is coming. Why should we? The unknown puts adventure into life. ... The unexpected around the corner gives a sense of anticipation and surprise. Thank God for the unknown future.
author: E. Stanley Jones

quote: I think I look good out there. I'm strong  powerful  and artistic. But I have my doubts as much as anyone.
author: Jill Trenary

quote: If I ever felt inclined to be timid as I was going into a room full of people  I would say to myself  "You're the cleverest member of one of the cleverest families in the cleverest class of the cleverest nation. ... Why should you be frightened?"
author: Beatrice Potter Webb

quote: Action will remove the doubts that theory cannot solve.
author: Tehyi Hsieh

quote: To Death I yield  but not to Doubt  who slays before!
author: Edith M. Thomas

quote: Soon after a heart-wrung decision  something inevitably occurs to cast doubt on your choice. Holding steady against that doubt usually proves your decision.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: Doubt breeds doubt.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: It's the moment you think you can't that you realize you can.
author: Celine Dion

quote: From a shy  timid girl I had become a woman of resolute character  who could no longer be frightened by the struggle with troubles.
author: Anna Dostoevsky

quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Doubts and mistrust are the mere panic of timid imagination  which the steadfast heart will conquer  and the large mind transcend.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Doubt indulged soon becomes doubt realized.
author: Frances Ridley Havergal

quote: When one devotes oneself to meditation  mental burdens  unnecessary worries  and wandering thoughts drop off one by one  life seems to run smoothly and pleasantly. A student may now depend on intuition to make decisions. As one acts on intuition  second thought  with its dualism  doubt and hesitation  does not arise.
author: Nyogen Senzaki

quote: In doubt  fear is the worst of prophets.
author: Statius

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. Let us move forward with strong and active faith.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: In case of doubt  decide in favor of what is correct.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: Faith and doubt both are needed  not as antagonists  but working side by side to take us around the unknown curve.
author: Lillian Smith

quote: Our doubts are traitors  and make us lose the good we often might win  by fearing to attempt.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.
author: William Wrigley

quote: When in doubt  do it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Yes  I have doubted. I have wandered off the path  but I always return. It is intuitive  an intrinsic  built-in sense of direction. I seem always to find my way home.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Doubt whom you will  but never yourself.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Self distrust is the cause of most of our failures. In the assurance of strength  there is strength  and they are the weakest  however strong  who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Doubt yourself and you doubt everything you see. Judge yourself and you see judges everywhere. But if you listen to the sound of your own voice  you can rise above doubt and judgment. And you can see forever.
author: Nancy Kerrigan

quote: To be ambitious for wealth  and yet always expecting to be poor  to be always doubting your ability to get what you long for  is like trying to reach east by traveling west. There is no philosophy which will help a man to succeed when he is always doubting his ability to do so  and thus attracting failure. No matter how hard you work for success  if your thought is saturated with the fear of failure  it will kill your efforts  neutralize your endeavors and make success impossible.
author: Charles Baudouin

quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life. Security is an insipid thing.
author: William Congreve

quote: I used to tremble from nerves so badly that the only way I could hold my head steady was to lower my chin practically to my chest and look up at Bogie. That was the beginning of "The Look."
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: When nothing is sure  everything is possible.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: Uncertainty and mystery are energies of life. Don't let them scare you unduly  for they keep boredom at bay and spark creativity.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: The quest for certainty blocks the search for meaning. Uncertainty is the very condition to impel man to unfold his powers.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: All uncertainly is fruitful... so long as it is accompanied by the wish to understand.
author: Antonio Machado

quote: I'm delighted that the future is unsure. That's the way it should be.
author: William Sloane Coffin

quote: When we are not sure  we are alive.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Freedom is nothing else but a chance to be better  whereas enslavement is a certainty of the worst.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent  intolerable uncertainty  not knowing what comes next.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: In the face of uncertainty  there is nothing wrong with hope.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: If there were dreams to sell  Merry and sad to tell  And the crier rung his bell  What would you buy?
author: T. L. Beddoes

quote: I dreamt that I dwelt in marble halls  With vassals and serfs at my side.
author: Alfred Bunn

quote: Abou Ben Adhem (may his tribe increase!) Awoke one night from a deep dream of peace.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: For dhrames always go by conthraries  my dear.
author: Samuel Lover

quote: We are such stuff As dreams are made on  and our little life Is rounded with a sleep.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Till the day when I'll be going down that Long  long trail with you.
author: Stoddard King

quote: When you're all dressed up and no place to go.
author: Benjamin Hapgood Burt

quote: If a woman were about to proceed to her execution  she would demand a little time to perfect her toilet.
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: Eat to please thyself  but dress to please others.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A torch-light procession marching down your throat.
author: John L. O'Sullivan

quote: First you take a drink  then the drink takes a drink  then the drink takes you.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: For when the wine is in  the wit is out.
author: Thomas Becon

quote: He neither drank  smoked  nor rode a bicycle. Living frugally  saving his money  he died early  surrounded by greedy relatives. It was a great lesson to me.
author: John Barrymore

quote: He who drinks a little too much drinks much too much.
author: Old saying

quote: I am only a beer teetotaller  not a champagne teetotaller.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I have never been drunk  but I've often been overserved.
author: George Gobel

quote: In vino Veritas. (In wine there is truth.)
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: The morning cup of coffee has an exhilaration about it which the cheering influence of the afternoon or evening cup of tea cannot be expected to reproduce.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: They talk of my drinking but never my thirst.
author: Old saying

quote: What  when drunk  one sees in other women  one sees in Garbo sober.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: You are not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
author: Dean Martin

quote: I like liquor - its taste and its effects - and that is just the reason why I never drink it.
author: Thomas Stonewall Jackson

quote: The Persians are very fond of wine ... It is also their general practice to deliberate upon affairs of weight when they are drunk  and then in the morning  when they are sober  the decision to which they came the night before is put before them by the master of the house in which it was made  and if it is then approved they act on it  if not  they set it aside. Sometimes  however  they are sober at their first deliberations  but in this case they always reconsider the matter under the influence of wine.
author: Herodotus

quote: Drunkenness is temporary suicide: the happiness that it brings is merely negative  a momentary cessation of unhappiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Bacchus has drowned more men than Neptune.
author: Guiseppe Garibaldi

quote: Temperance is the control of all the functions of our bodies. The man who refuses liquor  goes in for apple pie and develops a paunch  is no ethical leader for me.
author: John Erskine

quote: Nothing ever tasted any better than a cold beer on a beautiful afternoon with nothing to look forward to but more of the same.
author: Hugh Hood

quote: Moderation is commonly firm  and firmness is commonly successful.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Abstinence is as easy for me as temperance would be difficult.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I drink to make other people interesting.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: One of the disadvantages of wine is that is makes a man mistake words for thoughts.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The innkeeper loves the drunkard  but not for a son-in-law.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: Whisky drowns some troubles and floats a lot more.
author: Robert C. Edwards

quote: Malt does more than Milton can To justify God's ways to man.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: A man hath no better thing under the sun  than to eat  and to drink  and to be merry.
author: Bible

quote: Drink not the third glass - which thou can'st not tame when once it is within thee.
author: George Herbert

quote: An Irish queer: a fellow who prefers women to drink.
author: Sean O'Faolain

quote: Jellinek's disease (alcoholism) is responsible for: 50 percent of all auto fatalities 80 percent of all home violence 30 percent of all suicides 60 percent of all child abuse 65 percent of all drownings It is estimated that when a woman contracts the disease  her husband leaves her in nine out often cases  when a man contracts it  his wife leaves in one out of ten cases.
author: Kathleen Whalen Fitzgerald

quote: Eat bread at pleasure  drink wine by measure.
author: Randle Cotgrave

quote: We frequently hear of people dying from too much drinking. That this happens is a matter of record. But the blame almost always is placed on whisky. Why this should be I never could understand. You can die from drinking too much of anything - coffee  water  milk  soft drinks and all such stuff as that. And so long as the presence of death lurks with anyone who goes through the simple act of swallowing  I will make mine whisky.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: It's a naive domestic burgundy without any breeding  but I think you'll be amused by its presumption.
author: James Thurber

quote: Drunkenness is nothing but voluntary madness.
author: Seneca

quote: There are more old drunkards than old physicians.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: He is . . . like many other geniuses  a greater friend to the bottle  than the bottle is to him.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie

quote: Boys should abstain from all use of wine until their eighteenth year  for it is wrong to add fire to fire.
author: Plato

quote: I always keep a supply of stimulant handy in case I see a snake - which I also keep handy.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: We had gone out there to pass the beautiful day of high summer like true Irishmen - locked in the dark Snug of a public house.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: The whole world is about three drinks behind.
author: Humphrey Bogart

quote: Drunkenness is temporary suicide: the happiness that it brings is merely negative  a momentary cessation of unhappiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There was an old hen And she had a wooden leg  And every damned morning She laid another egg  She was the best damned chicken On the whole damned farm -  And another little drink Wouldn't do us any harm.
author: American Folksong

quote: It's a long time between drinks.
author: Anonymous

quote: He is a drunkard who takes more than three glasses  though he be not drunk.
author: Epictetus

quote: Drink today  and drown all sorrow  You shall perhaps not do it tomorrow.
author: John Fletcher

quote: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning  that they may follow strong drink  that continue until night  till wine inflame them.
author: Bible

quote: The habit of using ardent spirits by men in office has occasioned more injury to the public  and more trouble to me  than all other causes. Were I to commence my administration again  the first question I would ask respecting a candidate for office would be  Does he use ardent spirits?
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I would appeal to Philip  she said  but to Philip sober.
author: Valerius Maximus

quote: Drink! for you know not whence you came  nor why: Drink! for you know not why you go  nor where.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: All excess is ill  but drunkeness is of the worst sort. It spoils health  dismounts the mind  and unmans men. It reveals secrets  is quarrelsome  lascivious  impudent  dangerous and bad.
author: William Penn

quote: There St. John mingles with my friendly bowl The feat of reason and the flow of soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Water is the only drink for a wise man.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: To do my duty in that state of life unto which it shall please God to call me.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is thy duty oftentimes to do what thou wouldst not  thy duty  too  to leave undone that thou wouldst do.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: So nigh is grandeur to our dust  So near is God to man. When Duty whispers low  Thou must  The youth replies  I can.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No personal consideration should stand in the way of performing a public duty.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Let us have faith that right makes might  and in that faith let us  to the end  dare to do our duty as we understand it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: England expects every man to do his duty.
author: Lord Horatio Nelson

quote: Theirs not to make reply  Theirs not to reason why  Theirs but to do and die.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Not once or twice in our rough island story  The path of duty was the way to glory.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Early to bed and early to rise  Makes a man healthy  wealthy and wise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Tomb  thou shalt not hold Him longer  Death is strong  but Life is stronger  Stronger than the dark  the light  Stronger than the wrong  the right  Faith and Hope triumphant say Christ will rise on Easter Day.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: Come  ye saints  look here and wonder  See the place where Jesus lay  He has borne our sins away  Joyful tiding  Yes  the Lord has risen today.
author: Thomas Kelly

quote: "Christ the Lord is risen today " Sons of men and angels say. Raise your joys and triumphs high  Sing  ye heavens  and earth reply.
author: Charles Wesley

quote: In the bonds of Death He lay Who for our offense was slain  But the Lord is risen today  Christ hath brought us life again  Wherefore let us all rejoice  Singing loud  with cheerful voice  Hallelujah!
author: Martin Luther

quote: I envy people who drink - at least they know what to blame everything on.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: I knew I was drunk. I felt sophisticated and couldn't pronounce it.
author: Anonymous

quote: They say hot dogs can kill you. How do you know it's not the bun?
author: Jay Leno

quote: Enjoy life. Think of all the women who passed up dessert on the Titanic.
author: Anonymous

quote: According to my doctor it's okay to drink like a fish - as long as I drink what the fish drinks.
author: Anonymous

quote: I find the more I drink the more interesting others become.
author: Tom Ralphs

quote: I'd hate to be a teetotaler. Imagine getting up in the morning and knowing that's as good as you're going to feel all day.
author: Dean Martin

quote: I always keep a supply of stimulant handy in case I see a snake - which I also keep handy.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Everybody should believe in something  I believe I'll have another drink.
author: Anonymous

quote: Let's get out of these wet clothes and into a dry martini.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: I know lots more old drunks than old doctors.
author: Joe E. Lewis

quote: An alcoholic has been lightly defined as a man who drinks more than his own doctor.
author: Alvan L. Barach

quote: You're not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
author: Dean Martin

quote: Some people make spectacles of themselves with a couple of glasses.
author: Anonymous

quote: Most people hate the taste of beer to begin with. It is  however  a prejudice that many people have been able to overcome.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Let us eat and drink: for tomorrow we diet.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: He who laughs  lasts.
author: Mary Poole

quote: I exercise self-control and never touch any beverage stronger than gin before breakfast.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: For him  any wine dated before four o'clock in the afternoon is vintage.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: I'm not much of a drinker. It only takes me one drink to get drunk . . . my fourth.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: It was a woman who drove me to drink -  and you know  I never even thanked her.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Once during Prohibition  I was forced to live for days on nothing but food and water.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: There is nothing wrong with sobriety in moderation.
author: John Ciardi

quote: I started smoking to lose weight. After I dropped that lung I felt pretty good.
author: Michael Meehan

quote: You can tell German wine from vinegar ... by the label.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Let's toast a real wine expert - someone who knows a good rose goes best with bologna sandwiches.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: I have made it a rule never to smoke more than one cigar at a time.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I've noticed the customers in health food stores. They are pale  skinny people who usually look half dead. In a steak house  you see robust  ruddy people. They're dying  of course  but they look terrific.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: I'm a one-drink woman  two at the most  three I'm under the table  four I'm under the host.
author: Anonymous

quote: Is life worth living? That depends on the liver.
author: Anonymous

quote: I've never been drunk  but often I've been overserved.
author: George Gobel

quote: Eat  drink  and be merry  for tomorrow ye diet.
author: William Gilmore Beymer

quote: Tell me what you eat  and I will tell you what you are.
author: Anthelme Brillat Savarin

quote: Better halfe a loafe than no bread.
author: William Camden

quote: The proof of the pudding is in the eating.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Thou shouldst eat to live  not live to eat.
author: Cicero

quote: The nearer the bone  the sweeter the meat.
author: English proverb

quote: I want every peasant to have a chicken in his pot on Sundays.
author: Henry IV

quote: When I demanded of my friend what viands he preferred  He quoth: "A large cold bottle  and a small hot bird!"
author: Eugene Field

quote: Let us eat and drink  for tomorrow we shall die.
author: Bible

quote: For a man seldom thinks with more earnestness of anything than he does of his dinner.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Man shall not live by bread alone
author: Matthew

quote: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach.
author: Mrs. Sarah Payson

quote: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is  than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
author: Anonymous

quote: He hath eaten me out of house and home.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: They say fingers were made before forks  and hands before knives.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Bread is the staff of life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Buy not what you want  but what you have need of  what you do not want is dear at a farthing.
author: Anonymous

quote: He who will not economize will have to agonize.
author: Confucius

quote: After order and liberty  economy is one of the highest essentials of a free government.... Economy is always a guarantee of peace.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Beware of little expenses  a small leak will sink a great ship.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: No man is rich whose expenditure exceeds his means  and no one is poor whose incomings exceed his outgoings.
author: Thomas Haliburton

quote: Have more than thou showest  Speak less than thou knowest.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A gentleman need not know Latin  but he should at least have forgotten it.
author: Brander Matthews

quote: A one-book man is either a slow learner or an ill-equipped teacher.
author: Robert Burke

quote: Arrogance  pedantry  and dogmatism are the occupational diseases of those who spend their lives directing the intellects of the young.
author: Henry S. Canby

quote: Creatures whose main spring is curiosity will enjoy the accumulating of fact  far more than the pausing at times to reflect on those facts.
author: Clarence Day

quote: Good teaching is l/4th preparation and 3/4ths theatre.
author: Gail Godwin

quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance  one cannot fly into flying.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Learning makes a man fit company for himself.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I forget what I was taught. I only remember what I have learnt.
author: Patrick White

quote: I pay the School Master  but 'tis the school boys that educate my son.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you educate a man you educate a person  but if you educate a woman  you educate a family.
author: Rudy Manikan

quote: If you hit a pony over the nose at the outset of your acquaintance  he may not love you but he will take a deep interest in your movements ever afterwards.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: On many American campuses the only qualification for admission was the ability actually to find the campus and then discover a parking space.
author: Malcolm Bradbury

quote: One could get a first-class education from a shelf of books five feet long.
author: Charles William Eliot

quote: One father is more than 100 schoolmasters.
author: George Herbert

quote: One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers  but with gratitude to those who touched our human feelings. The curriculum is so much necessary raw material  but warmth is a vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Pedantry crams our heads with learned lumber and takes out brains to make room for it.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Tell me and I'll forget. Show me  and I may not remember. Involve me  and I'll understand.
author: Native American saying

quote: The average PhD thesis is nothing but a transference of bones from one graveyard to another.
author: J. Frank Dobie

quote: The true teacher defends his pupils against his own personal influence.
author: A. B. Alcott

quote: Today's public education system is a failed monopoly: bureaucratic  rigid and in unsteady control of dissatisfied captive markets.
author: David T. Kearns

quote: Education should be gentle and stern  not cold and lax.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Universities are the cathedrals of the modern age. They shouldn't have to justify their existence by utilitarian criteria.
author: David Lodge

quote: We should not value education as a means to prosperity  but prosperity as a means to education. Only then will our priorities be right. For education  unlike prosperity is an end in itself. .. power and influence come through the acquisition of useless knowledge. . . irrelevant subjects bring understanding of the human condition  by forcing the student to stand back from it.
author: Roger Scruton

quote: When there are two PhD's in a developing country  one is Head of State and the other is in exile.
author: Lord Samuel

quote: You don't understand anything until you learn it more than one way.
author: Marvin Minsky

quote: The schools ain't what they used to be and never was.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The things taught in schools are not an education but the means of an education.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The university is the last remaining platform for national dissent.
author: Leon Eisenberg

quote: The freshmen bring a little knowledge in and the seniors take none out  so it accumulates through the years.
author: A. Lawrence Lowell

quote: Surely the shortest commencement address in history - and for me one of the most memorable - was that of Dr. Harold E. Hyde  President of New Hampshire's Plymouth State College. He reduced his message to the graduating class to these three ideals: 'Know yourself- Socrates. Control yourself- Cicero  Give yourself - Christ.'
author: Walter T. Tatara

quote: There is that indescribable freshness and unconsciousness about an illiterate person that humbles and mocks the power of the noblest expressive genius.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Intelligence appears to be the thing that enables a man to get along without education. Education appears to be the thing that enables a man to get along without the use of his intelligence.
author: A. E. Wiggan

quote: By learning you will teach  by teaching you will learn.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Most men of education are more superstitious than they admit - nay  than they think.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: A university is what a college becomes when the faculty loses interest in students.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Education is indoctrination  if you're white - subjugation if you're black.
author: James Baldwin

quote: The investigation of the meaning of words is the beginning of education.
author: Antisthenes

quote: Learning to learn is to know how to navigate in a forest of facts  ideas and theories  a proliferation of constantly changing items of knowledge. Learning to learn is to know what to ignore but at the same time not rejecting innovation and research.
author: Raymond Queneau

quote: A good education should leave much to be desired.
author: Alan Gregg

quote: 'Whom are you?' he asked  for he had been to night school.
author: George Ade

quote: Education with inert ideas is not only useless  it is above all things harmful.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Schoolmasters and parents exist to be grown out of.
author: John Wolfenden

quote: A child educated only at school is an uneducated child.
author: George Santayana

quote: No one can become really educated without having pursued some study in which he took no interest. For it is part of education to interest ourselves in subjects for which we have no aptitude.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: It is in fact a part of the function of education to help us to escape  not from our own time - for we are bound by that - but from the intellectual and emotional limitations of our time.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Nothing in education is so astonishing as the amount of ignorance it accumulates in the form of inert facts.
author: Henry Adams

quote: You can lead a man up to the university  but you can't make him think.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: If you think education is expensive - try ignorance.
author: Derek Bok

quote: It is a greater work to educate a child  in the true and larger sense of the word  than to rule a state.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: There is less flogging in our great schools than formerly  but then less is learned there  so that what the boys get at one end they lose at the other.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Education is not the filling of a pail  but the lighting of a fire.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Perhaps the most valuable result of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do  when it ought to be done  whether you like it or not  it is the first lesson that ought to be learned  and however early a man's training begins  it is probably the last lesson that he learns thoroughly.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Some men are graduated from college cum laude  some are graduated summa cum laude  and some are graduated mirabile dictu.
author: William Howard Taft

quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
author: Robert Frost

quote: We must reject that most dismal and fatuous notion that education is a preparation for life.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Soon learnt  soon forgotten.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is of interest to note that while some dolphins are reported to have learned English - up to fifty words used in correct context - no human being has been reported to have learned dolphinese.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: And if the student finds that this is not to his taste  well  that is regrettable. Most regrettable. His taste should not be consulted  it is being formed.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Education  n: that which discloses to the wise and disguises from the foolish their lack of understanding.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: The Romans would never have had time to conquer the world if they had been obliged to learn Latin first of all.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: The antithesis between a technical and a liberal education is fallacious. There can be no adequate technical education which is not liberal  and no liberal education which is not technical.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: John Milton called his school  Christ College  'a stony-hearted stepmother'. The ultimate goal of the educational system is to shift to the individual the burden of pursuing his education.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: To make your children capable of honesty is the beginning of education.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Creative minds have always been known to survive any kind of bad training.
author: Anna Freud

quote: Fathers send their sons to college either because they went to college  or because they didn't.
author: L. L. Hendren

quote: Education today  more than ever before  must see clearly the dual objectives: education for living and educating for making a living.
author: James Mason Wood

quote: The test and the use of man's education is that he finds pleasure in the exercise of his mind.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: The Jews have always been students  and their greatest study is themselves.
author: Albert Goldman

quote: Whenever I'm asked what college I attended  I'm tempted to reply  Thornton Wilder'.
author: Garson Kanin

quote: Let the schools teach the nobility of labour and the beauty of human service: but the superstitions of ages past? Never!
author: Peter Cooper

quote: Education is what survives when what has been learnt has been forgotten.
author: B. F. Skinner

quote: I find the three major administrative problems on a campus are sex for the students  athletics for the alumni and parking for the faculty.
author: Clark Kerr

quote: All learning has an emotional base.
author: Plato

quote: Whatever is good to know is difficult to learn.
author: Greek proverb

quote: Thus education forms the common mind  Just as the twig is bent  the tree's inclined.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There is a time in every man's education when he arrives at the conviction that envy is ignorance  that imitation is suicide  that he must take himself for better  for worse as his portion.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: He couldn't get into Harvard even if he had the dean's wife at gunpoint.
author: Dave Barry

quote: College is the best time of your life. When else are your parents going to spend several thousand dollars a year just for you to go to a strange town and get drunk every night?
author: David Wood

quote: It's strange how few of the world's great problems are solved by people who remember their algebra.
author: Herbert Prochnow

quote: Those who go to college and never get out are called professors.
author: Anonymous

quote: You could do anything in your room at college. You could smoke pot  live in a coed dorm  have a girl. But you couldn't have a . . . hot plate!
author: Jay Leno

quote: My husband managed to cram four years of college into five.
author: Judy Hampton

quote: One little six-year-old took home a note saying he need not come to school since he was "too stupid to learn." That boy was Thomas Edison.
author: Anonymous

quote: Last words when sending our boy to college: "If there's anything you want  call us and we'll show you how to live without it."
author: Anonymous

quote: She's an honor student. She's always saying  "Yes  Your Honor. No  Your Honor."
author: Anonymous

quote: Bumper sticker: Driver carries no cash -  he has a son in college.
author: Anonymous

quote: Everyone is in awe of the lion tamer in a cage with half a dozen lions -  everyone but a school bus driver.
author: Anonymous

quote: It was going all wrong at my college interview until I nonchalantly asked  "Do you need any large donations for new buildings?"
author: Todd Anderson

quote: I won't say ours was a tough school  but we had our own coroner. We used to write essays like "What I'm Going to Be if I Grow Up."
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are a hundred thousand useless words in the English language  but they come in handy in college football yells.
author: Anonymous

quote: Passing the SAT: My personal theory is that it has to do with how much money you send them in the mail. I think the amounts they tell you to send are actually just suggested minimum donations - if you get my drift.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Bumper sticker: My kid beat the heck out of the student of the month.
author: Anonymous

quote: A kindergarten teacher is a woman who knows how to make little things count.
author: Anonymous

quote: When asked to spell Mississippi the boy asked  "The river or the state?"
author: Anonymous

quote: Letter home from  college boy: "There are 370 boys here - I wish there were 369."
author: Anonymous

quote: I used to keep my college roommate from reading my personal mail by hiding it in her textbooks.
author: Joan Welsh

quote: We didn't feel so good when we took our son to college and saw a sign on the liquor store - Back to School Sale.
author: Brian Morgan

quote: I went to a high school that was so dangerous  the school newspaper had an obituary column.
author: Rocky Ray

quote: "Do you think your boy will forget all he learned in college?" "I hope so. He can't make a living drinking."
author: Larry Wilde

quote: Do you know the difference between a kayak and a college student? A kayak tips.
author: Chad Morgan

quote: Some drink from the fountain of knowledge - others just gargle.
author: Anonymous

quote: Boy handing over his report card: Of course I seem stupid to my teachers . . . they're all college graduates.
author: Anonymous

quote: Graduation Speech: You'll have to excuse me if I cry. I've been a little teary-eyed all week  the sadness  the joy  . . . the fact that I'm off my parents' payroll.
author: Melissa Amernick

quote: Schoolhouses are the republican line of fortifications.
author: Horace Mann

quote: Education commences at the mother's knee  and every word spoken within the hearsay of little children tends towards the formation of character.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: What greater or better gift can we offer the republic than to teach and instruct our youth?
author: Cicero

quote: Training is everything. The peach was once a bitter almond  cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education.
author: Samuel L. Clemens

quote: The things taught in schools and colleges are not an education  but the means of education.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: 'Tis education forms the common mind  Just as the twig is bent the tree's inclined.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There is nothing so stupid as an educated man  if you get off the thing that he was educated in.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Education is the process of driving a set of prejudices down your throat.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quote: If a man empties his purse into his head  no one can take it from him.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Education is an admirable thing  but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: He did nothing in particular  And did it very well.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: The best carpenters make the fewest chips.
author: German proverb

quote: The reason why lovers are never wary of one another is this - they are always talking of themselves.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Do you wish men to speak well of you? Then never speak well of yourself.
author: Pascal

quote: Nothing is more to me than myself.
author: Max Stirner

quote: Eloquence is the poetry of prose.
author: William Cullen Bryant

quote: The manner of your speaking is full as important as the matter  as more people have ears to be tickled than understandings to judge.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has merely laid an egg cackles as if she laid an asteroid.
author: Samuel L. Clemens

quote: Thoughts that breathe and words that burn.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: True eloquence consists in saying all that is necessary  and nothing but what is necessary.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: The truth is forced upon us  very quickly  by a foe.
author: Aristophanes

quote: There is a road from the eye to the heart that does not go through the intellect.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: He hasn't an enemy in the world  and none of his friends like him.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Don't think there are no crocodiles because the water is calm.
author: Malayan proverb

quote: The enemies of the future are always the very nicest people.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: There is no man so friendless but what he can find a friend sincere enough to tell him disagreeable truths.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Enemies could become the best companions. Companionship is based on a common interest  and the greater the interest the closer the companionship. What makes enemies of people  if not the eagerness  the passion for the same thing?
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Whoever has his foe at his mercy  and does not kill him  is his own enemy.
author: Sa'di

quote: The little foxes that spoil the vines.
author: Bible

quote: We have met the enemy  and he is us.
author: Walt Kelly

quote: The space in a needle's eye is sufficient for two friends  but the whole world is scarcely big enough to hold two enemies. Solomon ibn Gabirol Whoso sheddeth man's blood  by man shall his blood be shed.
author: Bible

quote: If we could read the secret history of our enemies  we should find in each man's life  sorrow and suffering enough to disarm all hostility.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Those who hate you don't win unless you hate them - and then you destroy yourself.
author: Richard Nixon

quote: There's nothing like the sight of an old enemy down on his luck.
author: Euripides

quote: The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
author: Arabic proverb

quote: They love him most for the enemies that he has made.
author: General E. S. Bragg

quote: Man is his own worst enemy.
author: Cicero

quote: He who has a thousand friends has not a friend to spare  And he who has one enemy will meet him everywhere.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: None but yourself who are your greatest foe.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: If thine enemy hunger  feed him  if he thirst  give him drink.
author: Romans

quote: My prayer to God is a very short one "Oh Lord  make my enemies ridiculous!" God has granted it.
author: Voltaire

quote: A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: England is a nation of voyeurs.
author: Nigel Newton

quote: Every man has a House of Lords in his own head. Fears  prejudices  misconceptions - those are the peers and they are hereditary.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: George III ought never to have occurred. One can only wonder At so grotesque a blunder.
author: Edmund C. Bentley

quote: God save our Gracious King  Long live our Noble King  God save the King. Send Him victorious Happy and Glorious Long to rule over us God save the King.
author: Henry Carey

quote: Great Britain has lost an empire and has not yet found a role.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: His Majesty's dominions  on which the sun never sets.
author: Christopher North

quote: I have been trying all my life to like Scotchmen  and am obliged to desist from the experiment in despair.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: If I should die  think only this of me  that there's some corner of a foreign field that is for ever England.
author: Rupert Brooke

quote: It is impossible for an Englishman to open his mouth without making some other Englishman despise him.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Land of hope and glory  Mother of the Free How shall we extol thee who are borne of thee? Wider still and wider shall thy bounds be set  God who made thee mighty  make thee mightier yet.
author: A. C. Benson

quote: London is a roost for every bird.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Remember that you are an Englishman and consequently have won first prize in the lottery of life.
author: Cecil Rhodes

quote: Rule Britannia  Britannia  rule the waves  Britains never will be slaves.
author: James Thomson

quote: Snobbery - the "pox Britannica"
author: Anthony Sampson

quote: The difference between the vanity of a Frenchman and an Englishman seems to be this: The one thinks everything right that is French  the other thinks everything wrong that is not English.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The Empire is a Commonwealth of nations.
author: Lord Rosebery

quote: The English woman is so refined She has no bosom and no behind.
author: Stevie Smith

quote: The House of Lords is a model of how to care for the elderly.
author: Frank Field

quote: The House of Lords is like a glass of champagne that has stood for 5 days.
author: Clement Attlee

quote: The most dangerous thing in the world is to make a friend of an Englishman  because he'll come sleep in your closet rather than spend 10 shillings on a hotel.
author: Truman Capote

quote: The young Cambridge group  the group that stood for "freedom" and flannel trousers and flannel shirts open at the neck  and a well-bred sort of emotional anarchy  and a whispering  murmuring  sort of voice  and an ultra-sensitive sort of manner.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: There will always be an England While there's a country lane Wherever there's a cottage small Beside a field of grain.
author: Clark Ross Parker

quote: Without class differences  England would cease to be the living theatre it is.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: You must not miss Whitehall. At one end you'll find a statue of one of our kings who was beheaded  at the other  the monument to the man who did it. This is just an example of our attempts to be fair to everybody.
author: Thomas Appleton

quote: Though I love my country  I do not love my countrymen.
author: Lord Byron

quote: England has forty-two religions and only two sauces.
author: Voltaire

quote: England and America are two countries separated by the same language.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: In England I would rather be a man  a horse  a dog or a woman  in that order. In America I think the order would be reversed.
author: Bruce Gould

quote: England is the paradise of individuality  eccentricity  heresy  anomalies  hobbies and humours.
author: George Santayana

quote: Not only England  but every Englishman is an island.
author: Novalis

quote: The English instinctively admire any man who has no talent and is modest about it.
author: James Agate

quote: In the end it may well be that Britain will be more honoured by the historians for the way she disposed of an empire than for the way in which she acquired it.
author: David Ormsby Gore

quote: Oh  it's a snug little island! A right little  tight little island!
author: Thomas Dibdin

quote: I regard England as my wife and America as my mistress.
author: Cedric Hardwicke

quote: The Englishman respects your opinions  but he never thinks of your feelings.
author: Wilfrid Laurier

quote: The Englishman has all the qualities of a poker except its occasional warmth.
author: Daniel O'Connell

quote: The English never draw a line without blurring it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Socialism has been preached for so long  the British people no longer have any sense of personal responsibility.
author: Lord Thomson of Fleet

quote: Britain's best bulwarks are her wooden walls.
author: T. Augustine Arne

quote: Queen Victoria - a mixture of national landlady and actress.
author: V. S. Pritchett

quote: I think the British have the distinction above all other nations of being able to put new wine into old bottles without bursting them.
author: Clement Attlee

quote: Whatever the rest of the world thinks of the English gentleman  the English lady regards him apprehensively as something between God and a goat and equally formidable on both scores.
author: Margaret Halsey

quote: Deploring change is the unchangeable habit of all Englishmen. If you find any important figures who really like change  such as Bernard Shaw  Keir Hardie  Lloyd George  Selfridge or Disraeli  you will find that they are not really English at all  but Irish  Scotch  Welsh  American or Jewish. Englishmen make changes  sometimes great changes. But  secretly or openly  they always deplore them.
author: Raymond Postgate

quote: Where there is one Englishman there is a garden. Where there are two Englishmen there will be a club. But this does not mean any falling off in the number of gardens. There will be three. The club will have one too.
author: A. W. Smith

quote: What should they know of England  who only England know?
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The Lord Chief Justice of England recently said that the greater part of his judicial time was spent investigating collisions between propelled vehicles  each on its own side of the road  each sounding its horn and each stationary.
author: Philip Guedalla

quote: No one can be as calculatedly rude as the British  which amazes Americans  who do not understand studied insult and can only offer abuse as a substitute.
author: Paul Gallico

quote: The English have an extraordinary ability for flying into a great calm.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: We are articulate  but we are not particularly conversational. An Englishman won't talk for the sake of talking. He doesn't mind silence. But after the silence  he sometimes says something.
author: Robert Morley

quote: The nice sense of measure is certainly not one of Nature's gifts to her English children ... we have all of us yielded to infatuation at some moment of our lives.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: I find the Englishman to be him of all men who stands firmest in his shoes.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It seems to me that you can go sauntering along for a certain period  telling the English some interesting things about themselves  and then all at once it feels as if you had stepped on the prongs of a rake.
author: Patrick Campbell

quote: One matter Englishmen don't think in the least funny is their happy consciousness of possessing a deep sense of humour.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: The English may not like music  but they absolutely love the noise it makes.
author: Thomas Beecham

quote: That typically English characteristic for which there is no English name -esprit de corps.
author: Frank Adcock

quote: The British are just as keen to make money as the Americans  but they prefer hypocrisy to a blatantly commercial attitude.
author: Wendy Michener

quote: Nothing unites the English like war. Nothing divides them like Picasso.
author: Hugh Mills

quote: The British love permanence more than they love beauty.
author: Hugh Casson

quote: An Englishman thinks he is moral when he is only uncomfortable.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The British are terribly lazy about fighting. They like to get it over and done with and then set up a game of cricket.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: A Scotch mist may wet an Englishman to the skin.
author: English proverb

quote: If I should die  think only this of me: That there's some corner of a foreign field That is forever England.
author: Rupert Brooke

quote: Oh  to be in England  Now that April's there.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: In England there are sixty different religions  and only one sauce.
author: Marquis Caraccioli

quote: I have nothing to offer but blood  toil  tears and sweat.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Be England what she will  With all her faults  she is my country still.
author: Charles Churchill

quote: Let us therefore brace ourselves to our duties  and so -bear ourselves that  if the British Empire and its Commonwealth last for a thousand years  men will still say  "This was their finest hour."
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: O  it's a snug little island! A right little  tight little island!
author: Thomas Dibdin

quote: The English nation is never so great as in adversity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: We are indeed a nation of shopkeepers.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: For he might have been a Rooshian A French or Turk or Proosian  Or perhaps Italian. But in spite of all temptations To belong to other nations  He remains an Englishman.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: What have I done for you  England  my England? What is there I would not do  England  my own?
author: W. E. Henley

quote: Froth at the top  dregs at bottom  but the middle excellent.
author: Voltaire

quote: The royal throne of kings  this scepter'd isle  This earth of majesty  this seat of Mars  This other Eden  demi-paradise  This fortress built by nature for herself Against infection and the hand of war  This happy breed of men  this little world  This precious stone set in the silver sea.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: fights you on patriotic principles  he robs you on business principles  he enslaves you on imperial principles.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: When Britain first at Heaven's command  Arose from out the azure main  This was the charter of the land  And Guardian angels sung this strain  "Rule Britannia! rule the waves  Britons never will be slaves."
author: James Thomson

quote: An Englishman thinks he is moral when he is only uncomfortable.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A person buying ordinary products in a supermarket is in touch with his deepest emotions.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: A tavern chair is the throne of human felicity.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: After pleasant scratching comes unpleasant smarting.
author: Danish proverb

quote: Danger and delight grow on one stalk .
author: Old saying

quote: Leisure is being allowed to do nothing.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Pleasure for an hour  a bottle of wine  pleasure for a year  marriage  pleasure for a lifetime  a garden.
author: Chinese saying

quote: The test of pleasure is the memory it leaves behind. (Die Probe Eines Genusses ist Seine Erinnerung.)
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: The true spirit of delight  the exultation  the sense of being more than Man which is the touchstone of the highest excellence  is to be found in mathematics as surely as in poetry.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: We must like what we have when we don't have what we like.
author: Roger de Bussy-Rabutin

quote: What the mass media offer is not popular art  but entertainment which is intended to be consumed like food  forgotten  and replaced by a new dish.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Speed provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: To be able to use leisure intelligently will be the last product of an intelligent civilization.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first  to get what you want  and after that to enjoy it.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: That man is richest whose pleasures are the cheapest.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: All the great pleasures in life are silent.
author: Georges Clemenceau

quote: The only way to entertain some folks is to listen to them.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Enthusiasm is the greatest asset in the world. It beats money and power and influence.
author: Henry Chester

quote: Danger and delight grow on one stalk.
author: English proverb

quote: Every luxury must be paid for  and everything is a luxury  starting with being in the world.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: Enjoyment is not a goal  it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: Most of the luxuries  and many of the so-called comforts  of life are not only not indispensable  but positive hindrances to the elevation of mankind.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: To really enjoy the better things in life  one must first have experienced the things they are better than.
author: Oscar Homolka

quote: If you resolve to give up smoking  drinking and loving  you don't actually live longer  it just seems longer.
author: Clement Freud

quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life  when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: No one in this world needs a mink coat but a mink.
author: Anonymous

quote: One's first book  kiss  home run is always the best.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Let us have Wine and Women  Mirth and Laughter Sermons and soda-water the day after.
author: Lord Byron

quote: 1. If your stomach disputes you  lie down and pacify it with cool thoughts. 2. Keep the juices flowing by jangling around gently as you move. 3. Go very lightly on the vices such as carrying on in society. The social ramble ain't restful.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: Love  and do what you like.
author: St. Augustine

quote: Every good thing that comes is accompanied by trouble.
author: Maxwell Perkins

quote: All the things I really like to do are either immoral  illegal or fattening.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: The physically fit can enjoy their vices.
author: Lloyd Percival

quote: The superfluous is very necessary.
author: Voltaire

quote: There are three ingredients in the good life  learning  earning and yearning.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: A sense of wrongdoing is an enhancement of pleasure.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: From desire I plunge to its fulfilment  where I long once more for desire.
author: Goethe

quote: Unsatisfied desire is in itself more desirable than any other satisfaction.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Luxury is more deadly than any foe.
author: Juvenal

quote: With renunciation life begins.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: As I grow older  part of my emotional survival plan must be to actively seek inspiration instead of passively waiting for it to find me.
author: Bebe Moore Campbell

quote: Enthusiasm signifies God in us.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Enthusiasm is life.
author: Paul Scofield

quote: To sing is to love and affirm  to fly and soar  to coast into the hearts of the people who listen  to tell them that life is to live  that love is there  that nothing is a promise  but that beauty exists  and must be hunted for and found.
author: Joan Baez

quote: O lovely Sisters! is it true That they are all inspired by you  And write by inward magic charm'd  And high enthusiasm warm'd?
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: Enthusiasm is the most important thing in life.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Enthusiasm signifies God in us.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Life is enthusiasm  zest.
author: Sir Laurence Olivier

quote: There is only one big thing-desire. And before it  when it is big  all is little.
author: Willa Cather

quote: There is nothing greater than enthusiasm.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Enthusiasm is the most beautiful word on earth.
author: Christian Morgenstern

quote: Boredom is the fear of self.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: It is not opposition but indifference which separates men.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: Exuberance is beauty.
author: William Blake

quote: Enthusiasm moves the world.
author: Arthur James Balfour

quote: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire  women will like him.
author: Mae West

quote: What a man knows only through feeling can be explained only through enthusiasm.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: My enthusiasms ... constitute my reserves  my unexploited resources  perhaps my future.
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: I have always had a dread of becoming a passenger in life.
author: Margareth II, Queen of Denmark

quote: A continued atmosphere of hectic passion is very trying if you haven't got any of your own.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Nothing is so contagious as enthusiasm  it moves stones  it charms brutes. Enthusiasm is the genius of sincerity  and truth accomplishes no victories without it.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: The clue is not to ask in a miserly way-the key is to ask in a grand manner.
author: Ann Wigmore

quote: Energy is equal to desire and purpose.
author: Sheryl Adams

quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight  but the size of the fight in the dog.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: All we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Most great men and women are not perfectly rounded in their personalties  but are instead people whose one driving enthusiasm is so great it makes their faults seem insignificant.
author: Charles A. Cerami

quote: Winning isn't everything. Wanting to win is.
author: Catfish Hunter

quote: Vitality! That's the pursuit of life  isn't it?
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: In things pertaining to enthusiasm  no man is sane who does not know how to be insane on proper occasions.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Enthusiasm is the divine particle in our composition: with it we are great  generous  and true  without it  we are little  false  and mean.
author: L. E. Landon

quote: The great man is he who does not lose his childlike heart.
author: Mencius

quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
author: Christian Dior

quote: What hunger is in relation to food  zest is in relation to life.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Wake up with a smile and go after life.... Live it  enjoy it  taste it  smell it  feel it.
author: Joe Knapp

quote: What one has  one ought to use  and whatever he does  he should do with all his might.
author: Cicero

quote: Let us go singing as far as we go  the road will be less tedious.
author: Virgil

quote: And whatsoever ye do  do it heartily.
author: Bible

quote: You will do foolish things  but do them with enthusiasm.
author: Colette

quote: Whatever you attempt  go at it with spirit. Put some in!
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: Every man without passions has within him no principle of action  nor motive to act.
author: Claude Helvetius

quote: What is man but his passion?
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: We always attract into our lives whatever we think about most  believe in most strongly  expect on the deepest level  and imagine most vividly.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: You can have anything you want if you want it desperately enough. You must want it with an inner exuberance that erupts through the skin and joins the energy that created the world.
author: Sheila Graham

quote: Only passions  great passions  can elevate the soul to great things.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: No one has it who isn't capable of genuinely liking others  at least at the actual moment of meeting and speaking. Charm is always genuine  it may be superficial but it isn't fake.
author: P. D. James

quote: A willing heart adds feather to the heel.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: I really do believe I can accomplish a great deal with a big grin. I know some people find that disconcerting  but that doesn't matter.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Charm is a cunning self-forgetfulness.
author: Christina Stead

quote: Charm is the measure of attraction's power To chain the fleeting fancy of the hour.
author: Louisa Thomas

quote: Pm convinced that it's energy and humor. The two of them combined equal charm.
author: Judith Krantz

quote: Nothing great in the world has been accomplished without passion.
author: George Hegel

quote: If you're a champion  you have to have it in your heart.
author: Chris Evert

quote: Human nature  if it healthy  demands excitement  and if it does not obtain its thrilling excitement in the right way  it will seek it in the wrong. God never makes bloodless stoics  He makes no passionless saints.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: All passions exaggerate  it is because they do that they are passions.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: If we resist our passions  it is more from their weakness than from our strength.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Be still when you have nothing to say  when genuine passion moves you  say what you've got to say  and say it hot.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: The passions are the only orators which always persuade.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Passion  though a bad regulator  is a powerful spring.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Our passions are ourselves.
author: Anatole France

quote: People who never get carried away should be.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: This  indeed  is one of the eternal paradoxes of both life and literature-that without passion little gets done  yet  without control of that passion  its effects are largely ill or null.
author: F. L. Lucas

quote: When the habitually even-tempered suddenly fly into a passion  that explosion is apt to be more impressive than the outburst of the most violent amongst us.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: Optimism  unaccompanied by personal effort  is merely a state of mind and not fruitful.
author: Edward L. Curtis

quote: When enthusiasm is inspired by reason  controlled by caution  sound in theory  practical in application  reflects confidence  spreads good cheer  raises morale  inspires associates  arouses loyalty  and laughs at adversity  it is beyond price.
author: Coleman Cox

quote: The world belongs to the enthusiast who keeps cool.
author: William McFee

quote: Without passion man is a mere latent force and possibility  like the flint which awaits the shock of the iron before it can give forth its spark.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: If you aren't fired with enthusiasm  you will be fired with enthusiasm.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: You've got to sing like you don't need the money. You've got to love like you'll never get hurt. You've got to dance like there's nobody watching. You've got to come from the heart  if you want it to work.
author: Susanna Clark

quote: When his enthusiasm goes  he's through as a player.
author: Pete Rose

quote: Every production of genius must be the production of enthusiasm.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Give me a man who sings at his work.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: Drama is very important in life: You have to come on with a bang. You never want to go out with a whimper.
author: Julia Child

quote: The world belongs to the energetic.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The real difference between men is energy.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A faint endeavor ends in a sure defeat.
author: Hannah Moore

quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Success is going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: There is a passion for perfection which you rarely see fully developed  but... in successful lives it is never wholly lacking.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: Many of the most successful men I have known have never grown up. They have retained bubbling-over boyishness. They have relished wit  they have indulged in humor. They have not allowed "dignity" to depress them into moroseness. Youthfulness of spirit is the twin brother of optimism  and optimism is the stuff of which American business success is fashioned. Resist growing up!
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: If you have the will to win  you have achieved half your success  if you don't  you have achieved half your failure.
author: David V. A. Ambrose

quote: Someone's always saying  "It's not whether you win or lose " but if you feel that way  you're as good as dead.
author: James Caan

quote: To bring one's self to a frame of mind and to the proper energy to accomplish things that require plain hard work continuously is the one big battle that everyone has. When this battle is won for all time  then everything is easy.
author: Thomas A. Buckner

quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
author: C. Malesherbez

quote: Faith that the thing can be done is essential to any great achievement.
author: Thomas N. Carruther

quote: We can accomplish almost anything within our ability if we but think that we can!
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and of true progress.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm. Yes  more than enthusiasm  I would say excitement. I like to see men get excited. When they get excited they make a success of their lives.
author: Walter Chrysler

quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: The measure of an enthusiasm must be taken between interesting events. It is between bites that the lukewarm angler loses heart.
author: Edwin Way Teale

quote: Enthusiasm for one's goal to lessens the disagreeableness of working toward it.
author: Thomas Eakins

quote: To burn always with this hard gemlike flame. To maintain this ecstasy  is success in life.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Every man is enthusiastic at times. One man has enthusiasm for thirty minutes  another man has it for thirty days. But it is the man who has it for thirty years who makes a success in life.
author: Edward B. Butler

quote: Man never rises to great truths without enthusiasm.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Success is due less to ability than to zeal.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: I rate enthusiasm even above professional skill.
author: Sir Edward Appleton

quote: He did it with all his heart  and prospered.
author: Bible

quote: A strong passion for any object will ensure success  for the desire of the end will point out the means.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen. When we do our work with a dynamic  conquering spirit  we get things done.
author: Arland Gilbert

quote: If you're not happy every morning when you get up  leave for work  or start to work at home-if you're not enthusiastic about doing that  you're not going to be successful.
author: Donald M. Kendall

quote: The method of the enterprising is to plan with audacity and execute with vigor.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Do it big or stay in bed.
author: Larry Kelly

quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than to zeal.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: Zeal will do more than knowledge.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Let a man in a garret burn with enough intensity  and he will set fire to the world.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Knowledge is power  but enthusiasm pulls the switch.
author: Ivern Ball

quote: Through zeal  knowledge is gotten  through lack of zeal  knowledge is lost.
author: Buddha

quote: I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

quote: It is energy  the central element of which is will  that produces the miracles of enthusiasm in all ages. It is the mainspring of what is called force of character and the sustaining power of all great action.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: The difference between one man and another is not mere ability ... it is energy.
author: Thomas Arnold

quote: You see me in my most virile moment when you see me doing what I do. When I am directing  a special energy comes upon me. ... It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive. It is like having sex.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Energy  even like the Biblical grain of mustard-seed  will move mountains.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Energy will do anything that can be done in this world.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: The only thing that keeps a man going is energy. And what is energy but liking life?
author: Louis Auchincloss

quote: No one grows old by living  only by losing interest in living.
author: Marie Beynon Ray

quote: None are so old as those who have outlived enthusiasm.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Years wrinkle the face  but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
author: Watterson Lowe

quote: He fights with spirit as well as with the sword.
author: Latin proverb

quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

quote: The aim of military training is not just to prepare men for battle  but to make them long for it.
author: Louis Simpson

quote: Wars may be fought with weapons  but they are won by men. It is the spirit of men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Enthusiasm can only be aroused by two things: first  an ideal which takes the imagination by storm  and sec ond  a definite  intelligible plan for carrying that ideal into practice.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: Earnestness and sincereness are synonymous.
author: Corita Kent

quote: Opposition inflames the enthusiast  never converts him.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: No one keeps up his enthusiasm automatically. Enthusiasm must be nourished with new actions  new aspirations  new efforts  new vision. Compete with yourself  set your teeth and dive into the job of breaking your own record. It is one's own fault if his enthusiasm is gone  he has failed to feed it.
author: Anonymous

quote: The same reason makes a man a religious enthusiast that makes a man an enthusiast in any other way ... an uncomfortable mind in an uncomfortable body.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The great composer does not set to work because he is inspired  but becomes inspired because he is working. Beethoven  Wagner  Bach and Mozart settled down day after day to the job in hand with as much regularity as an accountant settles down each day to his figures. They didn't waste time waiting for inspiration.
author: Ernest Newman

quote: Enthusiasm is nothing more or less than faith in action.
author: Henry Chester

quote: Whatever course you have chosen for yourself  it will not be a chore but an adventure if you bring to it a sense of the glory of striving  if your sights are set far above the merely secure and mediocre.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: Vigor is contagious  and whatever makes us either think or feel strongly adds to our power and enlarges our field of action.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Practice being excited.
author: Bill Foster

quote: It is the greatest shot of adrenaline to be doing what you've wanted to do so badly. You almost feel like you could fly without the plane.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: Reason alone is insufficient to make us enthusiastic in any matter.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Nothing is so contagious as enthusiasm  it moves stones  it charms brutes. Enthusiasm is the genius of sincerity and truth accomplishes no victories without it.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The world belongs to the Enthusiast who keeps cool.
author: William McFee

quote: California is a fine place to live - if you happen to be an orange.
author: Fred Allen

quote: I asked a coughing friend of mine why he doesn't stop smoking. "In this town it wouldn't do any good " he explained. "I happen to be a chain breather."
author: Robert Sylvester

quote: I have every sympathy with the American who was so horrified by what he had read of the effects of smoking that he gave up reading.
author: Henry G. Strauss

quote: Population growth is the primary source of environmental damage.
author: Jacques Cousteau

quote: A moment's insight is sometimes worth a life's experience.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: All the world's a stage  And all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances  And one man in his time plays many parts.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The environment is everything that isn't me.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The most important thing about Spaceship Earth - an instruction book didn't come with it.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: For the first time in the history of the world  every human being is now subjected to contact with dangerous chemicals  from the moment of conception until death.
