quote: Best friend  my well-spring in the wilderness!
author: George Eliot

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A friend should be a master at guessing and keeping still.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I have lost friends  some by death ... others by sheer inability to cross the street.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Faithful are the wounds of a friend  but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
author: Bible

quote: An old friend never can be found  and nature has provided that he cannot easily be lost.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: One who's our friend is fond of us  one who's fond of us isn't necessarily our friend.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: True friends ... face in the same direction  toward common projects  interests  goals.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Friends are a second existence.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: My helpless friend  your helplessness is the most powerful plea which rises up to the tender father-heart of God. You think that everything is closed to you because you cannot pray. My friend  your helplessness is the very essence of prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Friends are a second existence.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: My helpless friend  your helplessness is the most powerful plea which rises up to the tender father-heart of God. You think that everything is closed to you because you cannot pray. My friend  your helplessness is the very essence of prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: I figure if I have my health  can pay the rent and I have my friends  I call it "content."
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: You leave home to seek your fortune and  when you get it  you go home and share it with your family.
author: Anita Baker

quote: If you have a good name  if you are right more often than you are wrong  if your children respect you  if your grandchildren are glad to see you  if your friends can count on you and you can count on them in time of trouble  if you can face your God and say "I have done my best " then you are a success.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Is there any stab as deep as wondering where and how much you failed those you loved?
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: My darling little girl-child  after such a long and troublesome waiting I now have you in my arms. I am alone no more  I have my baby.
author: Martha Martin

quote: A sympathetic friend can be quite dear as a brother.
author: Homer

quote: There's a time when you have to explain to your children why they were born  and it's a marvelous thing if you know the reason by then.
author: Hazel Scott

quote: Disorder in the society is the result of disorder in the family.
author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

quote: To nourish children and raise them against odds is in any time  any place  more valuable than to fix bolts in cars or design nuclear weapons.
author: Marilyn French

quote: I believe that we are always attracted to what we need most  an instinct leading us towards the persons who are to open new vistas in our lives and fill them with new knowledge.
author: Helene Iswolsky

quote: If you bungle raising your children  I don't think whatever else you do matters very much.
author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

quote: Friends are relatives you make for yourself.
author: Eustache Deschamps

quote: The darn trouble with cleaning the house is it gets dirty the next day anyway  so skip a week if you have to. The children are the most important thing.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: The presidency is temporary-but the family is permanent.
author: Yvonne de Gaulle

quote: Chance makes our parents  but choice makes our friends.
author: Jacques Delille

quote: God gave us our relatives  thank God we can choose our friends.
author: Ethel Watts Mumford

quote: A good friend is my nearest relation.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: It seems to me that since I've had children  I've grown richer and deeper. They may have slowed down my writing for a while  but when I did write  I had more of a self to speak from.
author: Anne Tyler

quote: All love that has not friendship for its base is like a mansion built upon the sand.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

quote: Biology is the least of what makes someone a mother.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: A hedge between keeps friendship green.
author: German proverb

quote: A man  Sir  should keep his friendship in constant repair.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Be a friend to thyself  and others will be so too.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship admits of differences of character  as love does that of sex.
author: Anonymous

quote: Friendship is love minus sex and plus reason. Love is friendship plus sex and minus reason.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: You shall judge of a man by his foes as well as by his friends.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: There are formalities between the closest of friends.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: If you press me to say why I loved him  I can say no more than it was because he was he  and I was 1.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Of my friends I am the only one I have left.
author: Terence

quote: Anybody amuses me for once. A new acquaintance is like a new book. I prefer it  even if bad  to a classic.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: My God  this is a hell of a job. I have no trouble with my enemies. I can take care of my enemies all right. But my damn friends  my goddamn friends. They're the ones that keep me walking the floor nights.
author: Warren G. Harding

quote: There are three faithful friends: an old wife  an old dog  and ready money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He makes no friend who never made a foe.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Give me the avowed  the erect  and manly foe  Bold I can meet  perhaps may turn the blow  But of all plagues  good Heaven  thy wrath can send  Save  save  oh save me from the candid friend!
author: George Canning

quote: It is not enough to succeed  a friend must fail.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: A friend in power is a friend lost.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Do not rely completely on any other human being  however dear. We meet all life's greatest tests alone.
author: Agnes Macphail

quote: You cannot be friends upon any other terms than upon the terms of equality.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: How often we find ourselves turning our backs on our actual friends  that we may go and meet their ideal cousins.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: We make our friends  we make our enemies  but God makes our next-door neighbour.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: You never know till you try to reach them how accessible men are  but you must approach each man by the right door.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A friend is one before whom I may think aloud.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Without friends no one would choose to live  though he had all other goods.
author: Aristotle

quote: The more we love our friends  the less we flatter them  it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.
author: Moliere

quote: It's important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them  and important to friendship that we are not.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: In life it is difficult to say who do you the most mischief  enemies with the worst intentions  or friends with the best.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: It is better to be deceived by one's friends than to deceive them.
author: Goethe

quote: We need new friends. Some of us are cannibals who have eaten their old friends up  others must have ever-renewed audiences before whom to re-enact an ideal version of their lives.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life  a community of thought  a rivalry of aim.
author: Henry Adams

quote: When my friends lack an eye  I look at them in profile.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: As in political  so in literary action  a man wins friends for himself mostly by the passion of his prejudices.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: God save me from my friends - I can protect myself from my enemies.
author: Marshall de Villars

quote: Never exaggerate your faults  your friends will attend to that.
author: Robert C. Edwards

quote: Don't tell your friends their social faults  they will cure the fault and never forgive you.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Iron sharpeneth man  so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
author: Bible

quote: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with a part of another  people are friends in spots.
author: George Santayana

quote: Who friendship with a knave hath made  Is judged a partner in the trade.
author: John Gay

quote: Chance makes our parents  but choice makes our friends.
author: Jacques Delille

quote: If we were all given by magic the power to read each other's thoughts  I suppose the first effect would be to dissolve all friendships.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness  thinking of others first . . . when you learn to live for others  they will live for you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Never join with your friend when he abuses his horse or his wife unless the one is to be sold  and the other to be buried.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The richest man in the world is not the one who still has the first dollar he ever earned. It's the man who still has his best friend.
author: Martha Mason

quote: It is better not to say "lend." There is only giving.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: They are rich who have true friends.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship is like money  easier made than kept.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: The rich know not who is his friend.
author: Anonymous

quote: Prosperity makes few friends.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: It is a good thing to be rich  it is a good thing to be strong  but it is a better thing to be beloved of many friends.
author: Euripides

quote: Better the friend we can see than the money we cannot.
author: Greek proverb

quote: Never have a friend that's poorer than yourself.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: It is better in times of need to have a friend rather than money.
author: Greek proverb

quote: The richer your friends  the more they will cost you.
author: Elizabeth Marbury

quote: Wealth maketh many friends.
author: Bible

quote: The friend who holds your hand and says the wrong thing is made of dearer stuff than the one who stays away.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The best mirror is an old friend.
author: George Herbert

quote: All you'll get from strangers is surface pleasantry or indifference. Only someone who loves you will criticize you.
author: Judith Crist

quote: Friendship is the perfection of love  and superior to love  it is love purified  exalted  proved by experience and a consent of minds. Love  Madam  may  and love does  often stop short of friendship.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: With true friends . . . even water drunk together is sweet enough.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Greater love has no man than this  that a man lay down his life for his friends.
author: Bible

quote: If there ever comes a day when we can't be together  keep me in your heart  I'll stay there forever.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Can miles truly separate you from friends. ... If you want to be with someone you love  aren't you already there?
author: Richard Bach

quote: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Sympathy constitutes friendship  but in love there is a sort of antipathy  or opposing passion. Each strives to be the other  and both together make up one whole.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: There's nothing worth the wear of winning but laughter  and the love of friends.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply rhan love. Love risks degenerating into obsession  friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: All love that has not friendship for its base  is like a mansion built upon the sand.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Platonic Love is a fool's name for the affection between a disability and a frost.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Platonic love is love from the neck up.
author: Tbyra Samter Winslow

quote: Friendship is love minus sex and plus reason. Love is friendship plus sex and minus reason.
author: Mason Cooky

quote: Love is blind  friendship closes its eyes.
author: Anonymous

quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship is a serious affection  the most sublime of all affections  because it is founded on principle  and cemented by time. The very reverse may be said of love. In a great degree  love and friendship cannot subsist in the same bosom  even when inspired by different objects they weaken or destroy each other  and for the same object can only be felt in succession. The vain fears and fond jealousies  the winds which fan the flame of love  when judiciously or artfully tempered  are both incompatible with the tender confidence and sincere respect of friendship.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: Accountability in friendship is the equivalent of love without strategy.
author: Anita Brookner

quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion  enmity  worship  love  but no friendship.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: What men call friendship is no more than a partnership  a mutual care of interests  an exchange of favors - in a word  it is a sort of traffic  in which self-love ever proposes to be the gainer.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: The more we love our friends  the less we flatter them  it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.
author: Moliere

quote: So long as we love we serve  so long as we are loved by others  I would almost say that we are indispensable  and no man is useless while he has a friend.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Friendship often ends in love  but love in friendship - never.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: When we hurt each other we should write it down in the sand  so the winds of forgiveness can make it go away for good. When we help each other we should chisel it in stone  lest we never forget the love of a friend.
author: Christian H. Godefroy

quote: Winning has always meant much to me  but winning ftiends has meant the most.
author: Babe Didrikson Zaharias

quote: Friends show their love - in times of trouble  not in happiness.
author: Euripides

quote: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Prosperity makes friends and adversity tries tliem.
author: Anonymous

quote: A friend is one who dislikes the same people that you dislike.
author: Anonymous

quote: A true friend is one soul in two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: Chance makes our parents  but choice makes our friends.
author: Jacques Delille

quote: The best way to keep your friends is to never owe them anything and never lend them anything.
author: Paul de Kock

quote: Forsake not an old friend  for the new is not comparable unto him. A new friend is as new wine: when it is old thou shalt drink it with pleasure.
author: Anonymous

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions  they pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

quote: If you have a friend worth loving  Love him. Yes  and let him know That you love him  ere life's evening Tinge his brow with sunset glow. Why should good words ne'er be said Of a friend till he is dead?
author: Daniel W. Hoyt

quote: I desire so to conduct the affairs of this administration that if at the end  when I come to lay down the reins of Ewer  I have lost every other friend on earth  I shall at st have one friend left  and that friend shall be down inside of me.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Friends are like melons. Shall I tell you why? To find one good  you must a hundred try.
author: Claude Mermet

quote: A man that hath friends must show himself friendly  and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
author: Bible

quote: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
author: English proverb

quote: There are three faithful friends: an old wife  an old dog  and ready money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I am wealthy in my friends.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A friend must not be injured  even in jest.
author: Syrus

quote: Reprove your friends in secret  praise them openly.
author: Syrus

quote: God same me from my friends  I can protect myself from my enemies.
author: Marshal de Villars

quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: True friendship is never serene.
author: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal

quote: In time of great anxiety we can draw power from our friends. We should at such times  however  avoid friends who sympathize too deeply  who give us pity rather than strength.
author: D. Lupton

quote: The firmest friendships have been formed in mutual adversity  as iron is most strongly united by the fiercest flame.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
author: Susan Ferrier

quote: Adversity not only draws people together  but brings forth that beautiful inward friendship.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
author: Richard Graves

quote: In times of difficulty friendship is on trial.
author: Greek proverb

quote: A friend is never known till a man has need.
author: Anonymous

quote: As the yellow gold is tried in fire  so the faith of friendship must be seen in adversity.
author: Ovid

quote: Friendship  of itself a holy tie  is made more sacred by adversity.
author: John Dryden

quote: He who endures penance and hardships for another delights in that person's company.
author: Malik Muhammad Jayasi

quote: A cheer  then  for the noble breast that fears not danger's post  And like the lifeboat  proves a friend  When friends are wanted most.
author: Eliza Cook

quote: There are moments in life when all that we can bear is the sense that our friend is near us  our wounds would wince at consoling words that would reveal the depths of our pain.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Prosperity makes friends  adversity tries them.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: That's the risk you take if you change: that people you've been involved with won't like the new you. But other people who do will come along.
author: Lisa Alther

quote: Friendship has splendors that love knows not. It grows stronger when crossed  whereas obstacles kill love. Friendship resists time  which wearies and severs couples. It has heights unknown to love.
author: Mariama Ba

quote: True friends are those who really know you but love you anyway.
author: Edna Buchanan

quote: Grief can take care of itself  but to get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with.
author: Mark Twain

quote: There is nothing better than the encouragement of a good friend.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: A friend is someone you can be alone with and have nothing to do and not be able to think of anything to say and be comfortable in the silence.
author: Sheryl Condie

quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4:00 a.m. that matter.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Perhaps the most delightful friendships are those in which there is much agreement  much disputation  and yet more personal liking.
author: George Eliot

quote: Prosperity is not just scale  adversity is the only balance to weigh friends.
author: Plutarch

quote: And we find at the end of a perfect day  The soul of a friend we've made.
author: Carrie Jacobs Bond

quote: Love is like the wild-rose briar  Friendship is like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose briar blooms  But which will bloom most constantly?
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Life without a friend is death without a witness.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Without friends no one would choose to live  though he had all other goods.
author: Aristotle

quote: We call that person who has lost his father  an orphan  and a widower  that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known that immense unhappiness of losing a friend  by what name do we call him? Here every language holds its peace in impotence.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: The great difference between voyages rests not in ships but in the people you meet on them.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: Only solitary men know the full joys of friendship. Others have their family  but to a solitary and an exile his friends are everything.
author: Willa Cather

quote: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble  and then not worth much after you get it.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Friendship is the bread of the heart.
author: Mary Russell Mitford

quote: There is no hope or joy except in human relations.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: I feel the need of relations and friendship  of affection  of friendly intercourse. ... I cannot miss these things without feeling  as does any other intelligent man  a void and a deep need.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Your wealth is where your friends are.
author: Plautus

quote: Today a man discovered gold and fame  Another flew the stormy seas  Another set an unarmed world aflame  One found the germ of a disease. But what high fates my path attend for I-today-I found a friend.
author: Helen Barker Parker

quote: Though Love be deeper  Friendship is more wide.
author: Corinne Roosevelt Robinson

quote: That is the best-to laugh with someone because you think the same things are funny.
author: Gloria Vanderbilt

quote: Can you understand how cruelly I feel the lack of friends who will believe in me a bit?
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: To have a good friend is one of the highest delights of life  to be a good friend is one of the noblest and most difficult undertakings.
author: Anonymous

quote: The two most important things in life are good friends and a strong bull pen.
author: Bob Lemon

quote: There is no wilderness like a life without friends  friendship multiplies blessings and minimizes misfortunes  it is a unique remedy against adversity  and it soothes the soul.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quote: Man's best support is a very dear friend.
author: Cicero

quote: A cheer  then  for the noblest breast That fears not danger's post  And like the lifeboat  proves a friend  When friends are wanted most.
author: Eliza Cook

quote: I know what things are good: friendship and work and conversation.
author: Rupert Brooke

quote: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures  and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quote: No medicine is more valuable  none more efficacious  none better suited to the cure of all our temporal ills than a friend to whom we may turn for consolation in time of trouble  and with whom we may share our happiness in time of joy.
author: Saint Alfred of Rievaulx

quote: My only sketch  profile  of heaven is a large blue sky  and larger than the biggest I have seen in June-and in it are my friends-every one of them.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: If I don't have friends  then I ain't nothing.
author: Billie Holiday

quote: Brotherhood is the very price and condition of man's survival.
author: Carlos P. Romulo

quote: One thing everybody in the world wants and needs is friendliness.
author: William E. Holler

quote: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: We take care of our health  we lay up money  we make our roof tight and our clothing sufficient  but who provides wisely that he shall not be wanting in the best property of all-friends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is no physician like a true friend.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is nothing meritorious but virtue and friendship.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The bird  a nest  the spider  a web  man  friendship.
author: William Blake

quote: True happiness ... arises  in the first place  from the enjoyment of one's self  and in the next from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: It was such a joy to see thee. I wish I could tell how much thee is to my life. I always turn to thee as a sort of rest.
author: Lady Henry Somerset

quote: Today a man discovered gold and fame  Another flew the stormy seas  Another set an unarmed world aflame  One found the germ of a disease. But what high fates my path attend: For I-today-I found a friend.
author: Helen Barker Parker

quote: Good friends  good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man is a knot  a web  a mesh into which relationships are tied. Only those relationships matter.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Friends are an aid to the young  to guard them from error  to the elderly  to attend to their wants and to supplement their failing power of action  to those in the prime of life  to assist them to noble deeds.
author: Aristotle

quote: Friendship is the allay of our sorrows  the ease of our passions  the discharge of our oppression  the sanctuary of our calamities  the counselor of our doubts  the clarity of our minds  the emission of our thoughts  the exercise and improvement of what we dedicate.
author: Jeremy Taylor

quote: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make life entirely happy  much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

quote: There's nothing worth the wear of winning but laughter  and the love of friends.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Each friend represents a world in us  a world possibly not born until they arrive  and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef  love  like being enlivened with champagne.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: One is taught by experience to put a premium on those few people who can appreciate you for what you are.
author: Gail Godwin

quote: Oh Dear! How unfortunate I am not to have anyone to weep with!
author: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal

quote: The worst solitude is to be destitute of sincere friendship.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: If you want an accounting of your worth  count your friends.
author: Merry Browne

quote: A man with few friends is only half-developed  there are whole sides of his nature which are locked up and have never been expressed. He cannot unlock them himself  he cannot even discover them  friends alone can stimulate him and open him.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: Tis the human touch in the world that counts-the touch of your hand and mine-Which means far more to the sinking heart than shelter or bread or wine For shelter is gone when the night is o'er  and bread lasts only a day But the touch of the hand and the sound of the voice Live on in the soul always.
author: Spencer M. Free

quote: Good company and good discourse are the very sinews of virtue.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: Friends are the sunshine of life.
author: John Hay

quote: My friends have made the story of my life. In a thousand ways they have turned my limitations into beautiful privileges  and enabled me to walk serene and happy in the shadow cast by my deprivation.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The support of one's personality is friends. A part of one's self and a real foundation and existence.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: No greater burden can be born by an individual than to know none who cares or understands.
author: Arthur H. Stainback

quote: My life seems to have become suddenly hollow  and I do not know what is hanging over me. I cannot even put the shadow that has fallen on me into words. At least into written words. I would give a great deal for a friend's voice.
author: John Addington Symonds

quote: A true friend is the best possession.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us  as the confidence of their help.
author: Epicurus

quote: Friends Make Life Bearable But I have certainty enough  For I am sure of you.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: Best friend  my well-spring in the wilderness!
author: George Eliot

quote: Plant a seed of friendship  reap a bouquet of happiness.
author: Lois L. Kaufman

quote: Our happiness in this world depends on the affections we are able to inspire.
author: Duchess Prazlin

quote: Some people go to priests  others to poetry  I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The family. We are a strange little band of characters trudging through life sharing diseases and toothpaste  coveting one another's desserts  hiding shampoo  locking each other out of our rooms  inflicting pain and kissing to heal it in the same instant  loving  laughing  defending  and trying to figure out the common thread that bound us all together.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: You hear a lot of dialogue on the death of the American family. Families aren't dying. They're merging into big conglomerates.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: If ever two were one  then surely we. If ever man were loved by wife  then thee.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: Friends are the family we choose for ourselves.
author: Edna Buchanan

quote: I think togetherness is a very important ingredient to family life. It's a cliche and we use it too much but I think for a husband and wife  the way to stay close is to do things together and share.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: Jimmy and I were always partners.
author: Rosalynn Carter

quote: He [Winston Churchill] has a future and I have a past  so we should be all right.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: Parents are friends that life gives us  friends are parents that the heart chooses.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: [My father] was generous with his affection  given to great  awkward  engulfing hugs  and I can remember so clearly the smell of his hugs  all starched shirt  tobacco  Old Spice  and Cutty Sark. Sometimes I think I've never been properly hugged since.
author: Linda Ellerbee

quote: Both within the family and without  our sisters hold up our mirrors: our images of who we are and of who we can dare to become.
author: Elizabeth Fishel

quote: Sisters define their rivalry in terms of competition for the gold cup of parental love. It is never perceived as a cup which runneth over  rather a finite vessel from which the more one sister drinks  the less is left over for the others.
author: Elizabeth Fishel

quote: The desire to be and have a sister is a primitive and profound one that may have everything or nothing to do with the family a woman is born to. It is a desire to know and be known by someone who shares blood and body  history and dreams.
author: Elizabeth Fishel

quote: Where there is lasting love  there is a family.
author: Shere Hite

quote: Is solace anywhere more comforting than in the arms of sisters?
author: Alice Walker

quote: Call it a clan  call it a network  call it a tribe  call it a family: Whatever you call it  whoever you are  you need one.
author: Jane Howard

quote: Old as she was  she still missed her daddy sometimes.
author: Gloria Naylor

quote: [Families] are made to make you forget yourself occasionally  so that the beautiful balance of life is not destroyed.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The family unit plays a critical role in our society and in the training of the generation to come.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

quote: Families will not be broken. Curse and expel them  send their children wandering  drown them in floods and fires  and old women will make songs of all these sorrows and sit in the porches and sing them on mild evenings.
author: Marilynne Robinson

quote: The family is the building block for whatever solidarity there is in society.
author: Jill Ruckelshaus

quote: Who ran to help me when I fell And would some pretty story tell Or kiss the place to make it well? My mother.
author: Jane Taylor

quote: All love that has not friendship for its base  Is like a mansion built upon the sand.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: One can find traces of every life in each life.
author: Susan Griffin

quote: Friendship is an art  and very few persons are born with a natural gift for it.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: The art of friendship has been little cultivated in our society.
author: Robert J. Havighurst

quote: We flatter those we scarcely know  We please the fleeting guest  And deal full many a thoughtless blow To those who love us best.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Good friendships are fragile things and require as much care as any other fragile and precious thing.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: Remember that you are all people and that all people are you.
author: Joy Harjo

quote: Human beings are born into this little span of life of which the best thing is its friendships and intimacies ... and yet they leave their friendships and intimacies with no cultivation  to grow as they will by the roadside  expecting them to "keep" by force of mere inertia.
author: William James

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Friendships  like marriages  are dependent on avoiding the unforgivable.
author: John D. MacDonald

quote: Beware of the danger signals that flag problems: silence  secretiveness  or sudden outburst.
author: Eleanor H. Porter

quote: To accept a favor from a friend is to confer one.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness  thinking of others first... when you learn to live for others  they will live for you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Blessed are they who have the gift of making friends  for it is one of God's best gifts. It involves many things  but above all  the power of getting out of one's self  and appreciating whatever is noble and loving in another.
author: Thomas Hughes

quote: Don't ask of your friends what you yourself can do.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: Half the secret of getting along with people is consideration of their values  the other half is tolerance in one's own views.
author: Daniel Frohman

quote: A true friend unbosoms freely  advises justly  assists readily  adventures boldly  takes all patiently  defends courageously  and continues a friend unchangeably.
author: William Penn

quote: Confidence is the foundation of friendship. If we give it  we will receive it.
author: Harry E. Humphreys

quote: There is a definite process by which one made people into friends  and it involved talking to them and listening to them for hours at a time.
author: Rebecca West

quote: Actions  not words  are the true criterion of the attachment of friends.
author: George Washington

quote: One who knows how to show and to accept kindness will be a friend better than any possession.
author: Sophocles

quote: Any man will usually get from other men what he is expecting from them. If he is looking for friendship  he will likely receive it. If his attitude is that of indifference  it will beget indifference. And if a man is looking for a fight  he will in all likelihood be accommodated in that.
author: John Richelsen

quote: There is nothing we like to see so much as the gleam of pleasure in a person's eye when he feels that we have sympathized with him  understood him  interested ourself in his welfare. At these moments something fine and spiritual passes between two friends. These moments are the moments worth living.
author: Don Marquis

quote: He does good to himself who does good to his friend.
author: Erasmus

quote: A sense of duty is useful in work  but offensive in personal relations. People wish to be liked  not endured with patient resignation.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: When a friend is in trouble  don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Loyalty is what we seek in friendship.
author: Cicero

quote: True friendship comes when silence between two people is comfortable.
author: Dave Tyson Gentry

quote: If two friends ask you to judge a dispute  don't accept  because you will lose one friend  on the other hand  if two strangers come with the same request  accept  because you will gain one friend.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Perhaps the most delightful friendships are those in which there is much agreement  much disputation  and yet more personal liking.
author: George Eliot

quote: There can be no friendship when there is no freedom. Friendship loves the free air  and will not be fenced up in straight and narrow enclosures.
author: William Penn

quote: You will find yourself refreshed by the presence of cheerful people. Why not make earnest effort to confer that pleasure on others?...Half the battle is gained if you never allow yourself to say anything gloomy.
author: Lydia M. Child

quote: Wear a smile and have friends  wear a scowl and have wrinkles.
author: George Eliot

quote: Lead the life that will make you kindly and friendly to everyone about you  and you will be surprised what a happy life you will live.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: Those who cannot give friendship will rarely receive it  and never hold it.
author: Dagobert D. Runes

quote: It is not the services we render them  but the services they render us  that attaches people to us.
author: Labiche et Martin

quote: We cherish our friends not for their ability to amuse us  but for ours to amuse them.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: It is foolish to make experiments upon the constancy of a friend  as upon the chastity of a wife.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Give and take makes good friends.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: A quarrel between friends  when made up  adds a new tie to friendship  as ... the callosity formed 'round a broken bone makes it stronger than before.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: No real friendship is ever made without an initial clashing which discloses the metal of each to each.
author: David Grayson

quote: Nothing wounds a friend like a want of confidence.
author: Jean Baptiste LaCordaire

quote: The first thing to learn in intercourse with others is non-interference with their own peculiar ways of being happy  provided those ways do not assume to interfere with ours.
author: William James

quote: No man can have society upon his own terms. If he seeks it  he must serve it too.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We cannot tell the precise moment when friendship is formed. As in filling a vessel drop by drop  there is at last a drop which makes it run over. So in a series of kindnesses there is  at last  one which makes the heart run over.
author: James Boswell

quote: Friendship is a plant which must be often watered.
author: Anonymous

quote: A friend should bear his friend's infirmities.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: No man is much pleased with a companion who does not increase  in some respect  his fondness of himself.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
author: Sophocles

quote: The condition which high friendship demands is the ability to do without it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Women can form a friendship with a man very well  but to preserve it  a slight physical antipathy most probably helps.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Love your friends as if they would some day hate you.
author: R. D. Hicks

quote: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
author: Eustace Budgell

quote: Friendship is the pleasing game of interchanging praise.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The hardest of all is learning to be a well of affection  and not a fountain  to show them that we love them  not when we feel like it  but when they do.
author: Nan Fairbrother

quote: If you want to be listened to  you should put in time listening.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: "Stay" is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: The only service a friend can really render is to keep up your courage by holding up to you a mirror in which you can see a noble image of yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The way to make a true friend is to be one. Friendship implies loyalty  esteem  cordiality  sympathy  affection  readiness to aid  to help  to stick  to fight for  if need be. ... Radiate friendship and it will return sevenfold.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: The most called-upon prerequisite of a friend is an accessible ear.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good  and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: Politeness is an inexpensive way of making friends.
author: William Feather

quote: The secret of success in society is a certain heartiness and sympathy.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Sometimes we owe a friend to the lucky circumstance that we give him no cause for envy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Friendship requires great communication.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Friendship requires more time than poor busy men can usually command.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We should behave to our friends as we would wish our friends to behave to us.
author: Aristotle

quote: You can make more friends in two months by becoming more interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get people interested in you.
author: Anonymous

quote: We secure our friends not by accepting favors but by doing them.
author: Thucydides

quote: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil. Tis the sole remedy against misfortune  the very ventilation of the soul.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: It is easier to visit friends than to live with them.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The loneliness you get by the sea is personal and alive. It doesn't subdue you and make you feel abject. It's stimulating loneliness.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: The chain of friendship  however bright  does not stand the attrition of constant close contact.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Fond as we are of our loved ones  there comes at times during their absence an unexplained peace.
author: Ann Shaw

quote: Friendship increases in visiting friends  but not in visiting them too often.
author: Anonymous

quote: Go oft to the house of thy friend  for weeds choke the unused path.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I am quite sure that no friendship yields its true pleasure and nobility of nature without frequent communication  sympathy and service.
author: George E. Woodberry

quote: I am learning to live close to the lives of my friends without ever seeing them. No miles of any measurement can separate your soul from mine.
author: John Muir

quote: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
author: Elizabeth Foley

quote: Friends are lost by calling often and calling seldom.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: A hedge between keeps friendships green.
author: Anonymous

quote: Solitude is one thing and loneliness is another.
author: May Sarton

quote: My friend and I have built a wall Between us thick and wide: The stones of it are laid in scorn And plastered high with pride.
author: Elizabeth Cutter Morrow

quote: When my friends lack an eye  I look at them in profile.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: You can always tell a real friend  when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: A friend is one who withholds judgment no matter how long you have his unanswered letter.
author: Sophie Irene Loeb

quote: The best rule of friendship is to keep your heart a little softer than your head.
author: Anonymous

quote: Who seeks a faultless friend remains friendless.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: Unless you bear with the faults of a friend you betray your own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Probably no man ever had a friend he did not dislike a little  we are all so constituted by nature that no one can possibly entirely approve of us.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Love your friend with his fault.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is well  when judging a friend  to remember that he is judging you with the same godlike and superior impartiality.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: To find a friend one must close one eye. To keep him ... two.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than a friend.
author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

quote: Sooner or later you've heard all your best friends have to say. Then comes the tolerance of real love.
author: Ned Rorem

quote: We shall never have friends if we expect to find them without fault.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: It is well there is no one without fault  for he would not have a friend in the world. He would seem to belong to a different species.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
author: David Storey

quote: To be social is to be forgiving.
author: Robert Frost

quote: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: It is better to be deceived by one's friends than to deceive them.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: The man who trusts other men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
author: Camillo Di Cavour

quote: It should be part of our private ritual to devote a quarter of an hour every day to the enumeration of the good qualities of our friends. When we are not active we fall back idly upon defects  even of those whom we most love.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: Friendship admits of difference of character  as love does that of sex.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: Between friends there is no need of justice.
author: Aristotle

quote: What I cannot love  I overlook.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Treat your fiends as you do your picture  and place them in their best light.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: Friendships aren't perfect and yet they are very precious. For me  not expecting perfection all in one place was a great release.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: A friend who cannot at a pinch remember a thing or two that never happened is as bad as one who does not know how to forget.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Being considerate of others will take you and your children further in life than any college or professional degree.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Nothing is ever lost by courtesy. It is the cheapest of pleasures  costs nothing  and conveys much. It pleases him who gives and receives and thus  like mercy  is twice blessed.
author: Erastus Wiman

quote: Truth is a rough  honest  helter-skelter terrier  that none like to see brought into their drawing rooms.
author: Ouida

quote: Friendship cannot live with ceremony  nor without civility.
author: Lord Halifax

quote: Don't flatter yourself that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. The nearer you come into relation with a person  the more necessary do tact and courtesy become.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Friends are like a pleasant park where you wish to go  while you may enjoy the flowers  you may not eat them.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Friendship is honey  but don't eat it all.
author: Moroccan proverb

quote: Except in cases of necessity  which are rare  leave your friend to learn unpleasant things from his enemies  they are ready enough to tell him.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It's important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them  and important to our friendship that we are not.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Don't tell your friends their social faults  they will cure the fault and never forgive you.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: There are worse words than cuss words  there are words that hurt.
author: Tillie Olsen

quote: Nobody likes having salt rubbed into their wounds  even if it is the salt of the earth.
author: Rebecca West

quote: Flattery makes friends  truth enemies.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Before a secret is told  one can often feel the weight of it in the atmosphere.
author: Susan Griffin

quote: A cruel story runs on wheels  and every hand oils the wheels as they run.
author: Ouida

quote: It is terrible to destroy a person's picture of himself in the interests of truth or some other abstraction.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: If we all told what we know of one another  there would not be four friends in the world
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: We all need somebody to talk to. It would be good if we talked ... not just pitter-patter  but real talk. We shouldn't be so afraid  because most people really like this contact  that you show you are vulnerable makes them free to be vulnerable.
author: Liv Ullmann

quote: If we were all given by magic the power to read each other's thoughts  I suppose the first effect would be to dissolve all friendships.
author: Anonymous

quote: The truth that is suppressed by friends is the readiest weapon of the enemy.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: So often the truth is told with hate  and lies are told with love.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Give me the avowed  the erect and manly foe  Bold I can meet  perhaps may turn the blow  But of all plagues  good Heaven  thy wrath can send  Save  oh save me from the candid friend!
author: George Canning

quote: A good friend can tell you what is the matter with you in a minute. He may not seem such a good friend after telling.
author: Arthur Brisbane

quote: Do not remove a fly from your friend's forehead with a hatchet.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
author: Robert Lynd

quote: There is not so good an understanding between any two  but the exposure by the one of a serious fault in the other will produce a misunderstanding in proportion to its heinousness.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A friend should be a master at guessing and keeping still.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A cheerful friend is like a sunny day  which sheds its brightness on all around.
author: John Lubbock

quote: The more we love our friends  the less we flatter them  it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.
author: Moliere

quote: It is the weak and confused who worship the pseudo-simplicities of brutal directness.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: What a wonderful thing it is to have a good friend. He identifies your innermost desires  and spares you the embarrassment of disclosing them to him yourself.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: I always felt that the great high privilege  relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Nobody who is afraid of laughing  and heartily too  at his friend can be said to have a true and thorough love for him.
author: Julius Charles Hare

quote: Don't believe your friends when they ask you to be honest with them. All they really want is to be maintained in the good opinion they have of themselves.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Only friends will tell you the truths you need to hear to make ... your life bearable.
author: Francine Du Plessix Gray

quote: Keep the other person's well-being in mind when you feel an attack of soul-purging truth coming on.
author: Betty White

quote: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends-you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it  that's the time to hold your tongue.
author: Alice Duer Miller

quote: Flatterers look like friends  as wolves like dogs.
author: George Chapman

quote: Friendship may sometimes step a few paces in advance of truth.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him  I may think aloud.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Oh  the comfort  the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person  having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words  but pouring them all out  just as they are  chaff and grain together  certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them  keep what is worth keeping  and with a breath of kindness blow the rest away.
author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
author: George Santayana

quote: I should like to tell you again of my bitter troubles so that mutually  by recounting our grief  we can lighten each other's sorrow.
author: The Kanteletar

quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself-an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly.
author: Antisthenes

quote: Since we are mortal  friendships are best kept to a moderate level  rather than sharing the very depths of our souls.
author: Hippolytus

quote: Forget your woes when you see your friend.
author: Priscian

quote: Those that lack friends to open themselves unto are cannibals of their own hearts.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Laugh  and the world laughs with you  weep and you weep alone.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: When good cheer is lacking  our friends will be packing.
author: Anonymous

quote: We have no more right to put our discordant states of mind into the lives of those around us and rob them of their sunshine and brightness than we have to enter their houses and steal their silverware.
author: Julia Seton

quote: 'Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense  and have her nonsense respected.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: There is no man that imparteth his joys to his friends  but he joyeth the more  and no man that imparteth his griefs to his friends  but he grieveth the less.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I am treating you as my friend  asking you to share my present minuses in the hope I can ask you to share my future pluses.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
author: Elizabeth Foley

quote: Trouble is a sieve through which we sift our acquaintances. Those too big to pass through are our friends.
author: Arlene Francis

quote: I have come to esteem history as a component of friendships. In my case at least friendships are not igneous but sedimentary.
author: Jane Howard

quote: No man can be happy without a friend  nor be sure of his friend till he is unhappy.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship makes prosperity more brilliant  and lightens adversity by dividing and sharing it.
author: Cicero

quote: The friend of my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: The growth of true friendship may be a lifelong affair.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Constant use had not worn ragged the fabric of their friendship.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Even where the affections are not strongly moved by any superior excellence  the companions of our childhood always possess a certain power over our minds which hardly any later friend can obtain.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: In prosperity our friends know us  in adversity we know our friends.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: 0 summer friendship  whose flat-tering leaves shadowed us in our prosperity  With the least gust  drop off in the autumn of adversity.
author: Philip Massinger

quote: 1 loathe a friend ... who takes his friend's prosperity but will not voyage with him in his grief.
author: Euripides

quote: In prosperity friends do not leave you unless desired  whereas in adversity they stay away of their own accord.
author: Demetrius

quote: There's no friend like someone who has known you since you were five.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo  but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I have lost friends  some by death ... others by sheer inability to cross the street.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Friendship was given by nature to be an assistant to virtue  not a companion in vice.
author: Cicero

quote: We are fonder of visiting our friends in health than in sickness. We judge less favorably of their characters when any misfortune happens to them  and a lucky hit  either in business or reputation  improves even their personal appearance in our eyes.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Women rely on friends. ... That's where we draw sustenance and find safety. We can count on our women friends when we need a good laugh or a good cry.
author: Cokie Roberts

quote: The shifts of fortune test the reliability of friends.
author: Cicero

quote: Never befriend the oppressed unless you are prepared to take on the oppressor.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Trouble shared is trouble halved.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Real friendship is shown in times of trouble  prosperity is full of friends.
author: Euripides

quote: Instead of loving your enemies  treat your friends a little better.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: One enemy is too many  a hundred friends too few.
author: Anonymous

quote: Faithful are the wounds of a friend  but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
author: Bible

quote: Friends come and go  enemies linger.
author: Anonymous

quote: The proper office of a friend is to side with you when you are in the wrong. Nearly everybody will side with you when you are in the right.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It isn't easy to be the person who sometimes has to try to preserve your happiness at the expense of your fun.
author: Margaret Culkin Banning

quote: I like a highland friend who will stand by me not only when I am in the right  but when I am a little in the wrong.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: I don't care a damn for your loyal service when you think I am right  when I really want it most is when you think I am wrong.
author: General Sir John Monash

quote: Nature has been for me  for as long as I remember  a source of solace  inspiration  adventure  and delight  a home  a teacher  a companion.
author: Lorraine Anderson

quote: However deep our devotion may be to parents or to children  it is our contemporaries alone with whom understanding is instinctive and entire.
author: Vera Brittain

quote: Writers seldom choose as friends those self-contained characters who are never in trouble  never unhappy or ill  never make mistakes  and always count their change when it is handed to them.
author: Catherine Drinker Bowen

quote: Fortify yourself with a flock of friends! You can select them at random  write to one  dine with one  visit one  or take your problems to one. There is always at least one who will understand  inspire  and give you the lift you may need at the time.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Many a person has held close  throughout their entire lives  two friends that always remained strange to one another  because one of them attracted by virtue of similarity  the other by difference.
author: Emil Ludwig

quote: Nothing is more limiting than a closed circle of acquaintanceship where every avenue of conversation has been explored and social exchanges are fixed in a known routine.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: A man with few friends is only half-developed  there are whole sides of his nature which are locked up and have never been expressed. He cannot unlock them himself  he cannot even discover them  friends alone can stimulate him and open him.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: Friendship is mutual blackmail elevated to the level of love.
author: Robin Morgan

quote: Scratch a lover  and find a foe.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: We need old friends to help us grow old and new friends to help us stay young.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with a part of another  people are friends in spots.
author: George Santayana

quote: It's the folks that depend on us for this and for the other that we most do miss.
author: Mary Webb

quote: Time's passage through the memory is like molten glass that can be opaque or crystallize at any given moment at will: a thousand days are melted into one conversation  one glance  one hurt  and one hurt can be shattered and sprinkled over a thousand.
author: Gloria Naylor

quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak  but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The wise man's ... friendship is capable of going to extremes with many people  evoked as it is by many qualities.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Now and then one sees a face which has kept its smile pure and undefiled. Such a smile transfigures  such a smile  if the artful but know it  is the greatest weapon a face can have.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: I cannot concentrate all my friendship on any single one of my friends because no one is complete enough in himself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: We need two kinds of acquaintances  one to complain to  while we boast to the others. -Logan Pearsall Smith No one person can possibly combine all the elements supposed to make up what everyone means by friendship.
author: Francis Marion Crawford

quote: Every organism requires an environment of friends  partly to shield it from violent changes  and partly to supply it with its wants.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of  we have a special face for each friend.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: An old friend never can be found  and nature has provided that he cannot easily be lost.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Years and years of happiness only make us realize how lucky we are to have friends that have shared and made that happiness a reality.
author: Robert E. Frederick

quote: To those who know thee not  no words can paint! And those who know thee  know all words are faint!
author: Hannah Moore

quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Old friends are the great blessing of one's later years. ... They have a memory of the same events and have the same mode of thinking.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: As in the case of wines that improve with age  the oldest friendships ought to be the most delightful.
author: Cicero

quote: There is a magic in the memory of a schoolboy friendship. It softens the heart  and even affects the nervous system of those who have no heart.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: It is great to have friends when one is young  but indeed it is still more so when you are getting old. When we are young  friends are  like everything else  a matter of course. In the old days we know what it means to have them.
author: Edvard Grieg

quote: When you are young and without success  you have only a few friends. Then  later on  when you are rich and famous  you still have a few ... if you are lucky.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Old friends  we say  are best  when some sudden disillusionment shakes our faith in a new comrade.
author: Gelett Burgess

quote: Friends and wine should be old.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Forsake not an old friend  for the new is not comparable to him  a new friend is as new wine.
author: Bible

quote: To be capable of steady friendship or lasting love are the two greatest proofs  not only of goodness of heart  but of strength of mind.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Ah  how good it feels! The hand of an old friend.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The best mirror is an old friend.
author: Anonymous

quote: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure because  of all the things granted us by wisdom  none is greater or better than friendship.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: There is only one thing better than making a new friend  and that is keeping an old one.
author: Elmer G. Letterman

quote: The only way not to break a friendship is not to drop it.
author: Julie Holz

quote: To throw away an honest friend is  as it were  to throw your life away.
author: Sophocles

quote: Hold a true friend with both your hands.
author: Nigerian proverb

quote: None is so rich as to throw away a friend.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: Those friends thou hast  and their adoption tried  grapple them to thy soul with hoops of steel.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: True friendship is like sound health  the value of it is seldom known until it be lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: We die as often as we lose a friend.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Affinities are rare. They come but a few times in a life. It is awful to risk losing one when it arrives.
author: Florence H. Winterburn

quote: Rather throw away that which is dearest to you  your own life  than turn away a good friend.
author: Sophocles

quote: Thine own friend  and thy father's friend  forsake not.
author: Bible

quote: The best way to keep your friends is not to give them away.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: I never enter a new company without the hope that I may discover a friend  perhaps the friend  sitting there with an expectant smile. That hope survives a thousand disappointments.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends  never lose a chance to make them.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life  he will soon find himself left alone.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Every man passes his life in the search after friendship.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What causes us to like new acquaintances is not so much weariness of our old ones  or the pleasure of change  as disgust at not being sufficiently admired by those who know us too well  and the hope of being admired more by those who do not know so much about us.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: A new acquaintance is like a new book. I prefer it  even if bad  to a classic.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To cement a new friendship  especially between foreigners or persons of a different social world  a spark with which both were secretly charged must fly from person to person  and cut across the accidents of place and time.
author: George Santayana

quote: A new friend is like new wine  when it has aged you will drink it with pleasure.
author: Apocrypha

quote: He alone has lost the art to live who cannot win new friends.
author: S. Weir Mitchell

quote: Five years from now you will be pretty much the same as you are today except for two things: the books you read and the people you get close to.
author: Charles Jones

quote: I want no men around me who have not the knack of making friends.
author: Frank A. Vanderlip

quote: Yes'm  old friends is always best  'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Many a friendship-long  loyal  and self-sacrificing-rested at first upon no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
author: Frederick W. Faber

quote: A home-made friend wears longer than one you buy in the market.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
author: Ethel Barrymore

quote: Accident counts for much in companionship  as in marriage.
author: Henry Adams

quote: We need new friends. Some of us are cannibals who have eaten their old friends up  others must have ever-renewed audiences before whom to re-enact an ideal version of their lives.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: In a world that holds books and babies and canyon trails  why should one condemn oneself to live day in  day out with people one does not like  and sell oneself to chaperone and correct them?
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings  and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: A man must eat a peck of salt with his friend before he knows him.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Have but few friends  though many acquaintances.
author: Anonymous

quote: One who's our friend is fond of us  one who's fond of us isn't necessarily our friend.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Make all good men your well-wishers  and then  in the years' steady sifting  some of them will turn into friends.
author: John Hay

quote: Distrust all those who love you extremely upon a very slight acquaintance and without any viable reason.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: We often choose a friend as we do a mistress  for no particular excellence in themselves  but merely from some circumstance that flatters our self-love.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: How casually and unobservedly we make all our most valued acquaintances.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Be courteous to all  but intimate with few  and let those few be well-tried before you give them your confidence.
author: George Washington

quote: Be slow to fall into friendship  but when thou art in  continue firm and constant.
author: Socrates

quote: How often we find ourselves turning our backs on our actual friends  that we may go and meet their ideal cousins.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Let him have the key of thy heart  who hath the lock of his own.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: Books and friends should be few but good.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sudden friendship  sure repentance.
author: Anonymous

quote: As there are some flowers which you should smell but slightly to extract all that is pleasant in them ... so there are some men with whom a slight acquaintance is quite sufficient to draw out all that is agreeable  a more intimate one would be unsafe and unsatisfactory.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: Acquaintance I would have  but when it depends not on the number  but the choice of friends.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Always set high value on spontaneous kindness. He whose inclination prompts him to cultivate your friendship of his own accord will love you more than one whom you have been at pains to attach to you.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Friendship that flames goes out in a flash.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Trouble is a sieve through which we sift our acquaintances. Those too big to pass through are our friends.
author: Arlene Francis

quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work  but friendship is a slow-ripening fruit.
author: Aristotle

quote: Be slow in choosing a friend  slower in changing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Every man is like the company he is wont to keep.
author: Euripides

quote: Treat your friends as you do your picture  and place them in their best light.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: Character builds slowly  but it can be torn down with incredible swiftness.
author: Faith Baldwin

quote: He that lies down with dogs shall rise up with fleas.
author: Anonymous

quote: If I wanted to become a tramp  I would seek information and advice from the most successful tramp I could find. If I wanted to become a failure  I would seek advice from men who have never succeeded. If I wanted to succeed in all things  I would look around me for those who are succeeding  and do as they have done.
author: Joseph Marshall Wade

quote: Better fare hard with good men than feast with bad.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: By associating with good and evil persons a man acquires the virtues and vices which they possess  even as the wind blowing over different places takes along good and bad odors.
author: The Panchatantra

quote: I would prefer as a friend a good man who is ignorant than one more clever who is evil  too.
author: Euripides

quote: Tell me whom you frequent  and I will tell you who you are.
author: French proverb

quote: Associate yourself with men of good quality if you esteem your own reputation  for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

quote: Go to the place where the thing you wish to know is native  your best teacher is there. ... You acquire a language most readily in the country where it is spoken  you study mineralogy best among miners  and so with everything else.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Tell me thy company  and I'll tell thee what thou art.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Who friendship with a knave hath made  is judged a partner in the trade.
author: John Gay

quote: The lion is ashamed  it's true  when he hunts with the fox.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise.
author: Solomon

quote: Life is partly what we make it  and partly what it is made by the friends we choose.
author: Tehyi Hsieh

quote: If you always live with those who are lame  you will yourself learn to limp.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Keep good men company  and you shall be of their number.
author: Anonymous

quote: A man becomes like those whose society he loves.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: A wise man associating with the vicious becomes an idiot  a dog traveling with good men becomes a rational being.
author: Arab proverb

quote: It is better to weep with wise men than to laugh with fools.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A wise man may look ridiculous in the company of fools.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: 111 company is like a dog  who dirts those most whom he loves best.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Satan's friendship reaches to the prison door.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
author: Confucius

quote: Friendship is seldom lasting but between equals  or where the superiority on one side is reduced by some equivalent advantage on the other.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Friendship neither finds nor makes equals.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: You cannot be friends upon any other terms than upon the terms of equality.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A man is known by the company he keeps.
author: Anonymous

quote: Friendship is nothing else than an accord in all things  human and divine  conjoined with mutual goodwill and affection.
author: Cicero

quote: Friendship is a union of spirits  a marriage of hearts  and the bond there of virtue.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: To associate with other like-minded people in small purposeful groups is for the great majority of men and women a source of profound psychological satisfaction.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Shared joys make a friend  not shared sufferings.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Seek those who find your road agreeable  your personality and mind stimulating  your philosophy acceptable  and your experiences helpful. Let those who do not  seek their own kind.
author: Jean-Henri Fabre

quote: To like and dislike the same things  this is what makes a solid friendship.
author: Sallust

quote: Friendship is only a reciprocal conciliation of interests.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life  a community of thought  a rivalry of aim.
author: Henry Adams

quote: True friends ... face in the same direction  toward common projects  interests  goals.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: That friendship may be at once fond and lasting  there must not only be equal virtue on each part  but virtue of the same kind  not only the same end must be proposed  but the same means must be approved by both.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: It is characteristic of spontaneous friendship to take on  without enquiry and almost at first sight  the unseen doings and unspoken sentiments of our friends  the part known gives us evidence enough that the unknown part cannot be much amiss.
author: George Santayana

quote: Men only become friends by community of pleasures.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship  we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: The reward of friendship is itself. The man who hopes for anything else does not understand what true friendship is.
author: Saint Alfred of Rievaulx

quote: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: The friendships which last are those wherein each friend respects the other's dignity to the point of not really wanting anything from him.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
author: Aristotle

quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: I have always differentiated between two types of friends  those who want proofs of friendship  and those who do not. One kind loves me for myself  and the others for themselves.
author: Gerard de Nerval

quote: Friendship  like credit  is highest where it is not used.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
author: James F. Byrnes

quote: I have learned that to have a good friend is the purest of all God's gifts  for it is a love that has no exchange of payment.
author: Frances Farmer

quote: If you press me to say why I loved him  I can say no more than because he was he  and I was I.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: He who looks for advantage out of friendship strips it all of its nobility.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility  never an opportunity.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Friendship with oneself is all-important  because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: In a friend you find a second self.
author: Isabelle Norto

quote: Of my friends  I am the only one I have left.
author: Terence

quote: I desire so to conduct the affairs of this administration that if at the end ... I have lost every other friend on earth  I shall at least have one friend left  and that friend shall be down inside of me.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Be a friend to thyself  and others will be so too.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship is neither a formality nor a mode: it is rather a life.
author: David Grayson

quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
author: Mencius

quote: Friendship's a noble name  'tis love refined.
author: Susannah Centlivre

quote: A friend is  as it were  a second self.
author: Cicero

quote: Friend: One who knows all about you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: A friend is like a poem.
author: Persian proverb

quote: A friend is a present you give to yourself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: A friend is someone you can do nothing with  and enjoy it.
author: The Optimist

quote: Friendship needs no words-it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
