quote: What else are we gonna live by if not dreams? We need to believe in something. What would really drive us crazy is to believe this reality we run into every day is all there is. If I don't believe that there's a happy ending out there-that will-you-marry-me in the sky-I can't keep working today.
author: Jill Robinson

quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: I am always more interested in what I am about to do than in what I have already done.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: We have believed-and we do believe now-that freedom is indivisible  that peace is indivisible  that economic prosperity is indivisible.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: I always ask the question  "Is this what I want in my life?"
author: Kathy Ireland

quote: Tell them that as soon as I can walk I'm going to fly!
author: Bessie Coleman

quote: He who demands little gets it.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: Unless in one thing or another we are straining toward perfection  we have forfeited our manhood.
author: Stephen McKenna

quote: It is necessary to try to surpass one's self always  this occupation ought to last as long as life.
author: Christina Augusta

quote: I was born to be a remarkable woman  it matters little in what way or how. ... I shall be famous or I will die.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: I never intended to become a run-of-the-mill person.
author: Barbara Jordaon

quote: There is only one real sin and that is to persuade oneself that the second best is anything but second best.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Too low they build  who build beneath the stars.
author: Edward Young

quote: I have the same goal I've had ever since I was a little girl. I want to rule the world.
author: Madonna

quote: Your world is as big as you make it.
author: Georgia Douglas Johnson

quote: Whatever course you have chosen for yourself  it will not be a chore but an adventure if you bring to it a sense of the glory of striving  if your sights are set far above the merely secure and mediocre.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second  that's what happens to you.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Aim at heaven and you get earth thrown in  aim at earth and you get neither.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: I truly believe that before I retire from public office  I'll be voting for a woman for president.
author: Barbara Mikulski

quote: We are all in the gutter  but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If I smashed the traditions it was because I knew no traditions.
author: Maude Adams

quote: Aim at perfection in everything  though in most things it is unattainable. However they who aim at it  and persevere  will come much nearer to it than those whose laziness and despondency make them give it up as unattainable.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: One may miss the mark by aiming too high  as too low.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss it  you will land among the stars.
author: Les Brown

quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark. Every act hath some falsehood or exaggeration in it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Life is a petty thing unless it is moved by the indomitable urge to extend its boundaries.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Far away in the sunshine are my highest inspirations. I many not reach them  but I can look up and see the beauty  believe in them and try to follow where they lead.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: A man's worth is no greater than the worth of his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Not failure  but low aim  is crime.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: On the human chessboard  all moves are possible.
author: Miriam Schiff

quote: Great is the road I climb  but... the garland offered by an easier effort is not worth the gathering.
author: Propertius

quote: I never took a position we were going to be a good ball club. I took the position we were going to be a winning ball club.
author: Red Auerbach

quote: Man's reach should exceed his grasp  or what's a heaven for?
author: Robert Browning

quote: Before you begin a thing  remind yourself that difficulties and delays quite impossible to foresee are ahead. ... You can only see one thing clearly and that is your goal. Form a mental vision of that and cling to it through thick and thin.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: You have to erect a fence and say  "Okay  scale this."
author: Linda Ronstadt

quote: You can change your beliefs so they empower your dreams and desires. Create a strong belief in yourself and what you want.
author: Marcia Wieder

quote: Man can only receive what he sees himself receiving.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: A person can grow only as much as his horizon allows.
author: John Powell

quote: You must learn day by day  year by year  to broaden your horizon. The more things you love  the more you are interested in  the more you enjoy  the more you are indignant about  the more you have left when anything happens.
author: Ethel Barrymore

quote: Enjoyment is not a goal  it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: What our deepest self craves is not mere enjoyment  but some supreme purpose that will enlist all our powers and give unity and direction to our life.
author: Henry J. Golding

quote: The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose  aiming at something outside self.
author: Hugh Black

quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: There is more to life than just existing and having a pleasant time.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Happiness is not the end of life  character is.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A good goal is like a strenuous exercise-it makes you stretch.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
author: Joanna Field

quote: Growth is not concerned with itself.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: The self-confidence one builds from achieving difficult things and accomplishing goals is the most beautiful thing of all.
author: Madonna

quote: If ambition doesn't hurt you  you haven't got it.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: We need to restore the full meaning of that old word  duty. It is the other side of rights.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: This is true joy of life-being used for a purpose that is recognized by yourself as a mighty one ... instead of being a feverish  selfish little clod of ailments and grievances  complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: That is happiness: to be dissolved into something completely great.
author: Willa Cather

quote: I looked on child rearing not only as a work of love and duty but as a profession that was fully as interesting and challenging as any honorable profession in the world and one that demanded the best I could bring to it.
author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
author: George Washington

quote: The measure of a life  after all  is not its duration  but its donation.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: When we ... devote ourselves to the strict and unsparing performance of duty  ihen happiness comes of itself.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: Duties are what make life most worth living. Lacking them  you are not necessary to anyone.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Seek happiness for its own sake  and you will not find it  seek for duty  and happiness will follow  as the shadow comes with the sunshine.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: True happiness ... is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
author: William Cowper

quote: True happiness  we are told  consists in getting out of one's self  but the point is not only to get out  you must stay out  and to stay out  you must have some absorbing errand.
author: Henry James

quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: The happiest excitement in life is to be convinced that one is fighting for all one is worth on behalf of some clearly seen and deeply felt good.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: The secret of living is to find ... the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: He who never sacrificed a present to a future good  or a personal to a general one  can speak of happiness only as the blind speak of color.
author: Horace Mann

quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The full-grown modern human being ... is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
author: R. Briffault

quote: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere  wholeheartedly  one-directionally  without regret or reservation.
author: William H. Sheldon

quote: A man's happiness: to do the things proper to man.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Happy the man who knows his duties!
author: Christian Furchtegott Gellert

quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
author: William J. Locke

quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: Give a man health and a course to steer  and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.
author: E. J. Bartek

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: Without duty  life is soft and boneless.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
author: Will Durant

quote: I probably hold the distinction of being one movie star who  by all laws of logic  should never have made it. At each stage of my career  I lacked the experience.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: The man who succeeds above his fellows is the one who early in life discerns his object and toward that object habitually directs his powers. Even genius itself is but fine observation strengthened by fixity of purpose.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined  he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A determinate purpose of life  and steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages  are indispensable conditions of success.
author: William M. Punshion

quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The man who fails because he aims astray  or because he does not aim at all  is to be found everywhere.
author: Frank Swinnerton

quote: Life has ... taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors. She taught me to seek sustenance from the endeavor itself  but to leave the result to God.
author: Alan Paton

quote: The object of war is not to die for your country  but to make the other bastard die for his.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: The object of war is to survive it.
author: John Irving

quote: If we want a free and peaceful world  if we want to make the deserts bloom and man grow to greater dignity as a human being-we can do it.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The most comprehensive formulation of therapeutic goals is the striving for wholeheartedness: to be without pretense  to be emotionally sincere  to be able to put the whole of oneself into one's feelings  one's work  one's beliefs.
author: Karen Horney

quote: I think the purpose of life is to be useful  to be responsible  to be honorable  to be compassionate. It is  after all  to matter: to count  to stand for something  to have made some difference that you lived at all.
author: Leo C. Rosten

quote: Only when men are connected to large  universal goals are they really happy-and one result of their happiness is a rush of creative activity.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: The great business of life is to be  to do  to do without  and to depart.
author: John Morley

quote: The proper function of man is to live-not to exist.
author: Jack London

quote: Life's objective is life itself.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: I seek the utmost pleasure and the least pain.
author: Plautus

quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first  to get what you want  and after that to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: I am searching for that which every man seeks-peace and rest.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Reach high  for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep  for every dream precedes the goal.
author: Pamela Vaull Starr

quote: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: The one thing worth living for is to keep one's soul pure.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
author: William James

quote: How to make God laugh. Tell him your future plans.
author: Woody Allen

quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: God gives the milk but not the pail.
author: English proverb

quote: God Himself is not secure  having given man dominion over His work.
author: Helen Keller

quote: God is a circle whose centre is everywhere and circumference nowhere.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is not dead but alive and well and working on a much less ambitious project.
author: Graffiti

quote: God pays  but not weekly wages.
author: Polish proverb

quote: God seems to have the receiver off the hook.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: God uses lust to impel men to marry  ambition to office  avarice to earning  and fear to faith. God led me like an old blind goat.
author: Martin Luther

quote: God will provide - if only God would provide until he provides.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: God  when he makes the prophet  does not unmake the man.
author: John Locke

quote: He maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good  and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.
author: Jesus Christ

quote: I wouldn't put it past God to arrange a virgin birth if he wanted to  but I very much doubt if he would because it seems to be contrary to the way in which he deals with persons and brings his wonders out of natural personal relationships.
author: Right Rev. David Jenkins

quote: If Jesus was Jewish  how come he has a Mexican name?
author: Anonymous

quote: In the faces of men and women I see God and in my own face in the glass  I find letters from God dropt in the street  and every one is signed by God's name  and I leave them where they are  for I know that wheresoever I go others will punctually come for ever and ever.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The glory of God is in man fully alive.
author: St. Irenaeus

quote: The Vatican is against surrogate mothers. Good thing they didn't have that rule when Jesus was born.
author: Elayne Boosler

quote: The worst that you can say about him (God) is that basically he's an underachiever.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Though the mills of God grind slowly  yet they grind exceeding small  Though with patience He stands waiting  with exactness grinds he all.
author: Friedrich von Logau

quote: Try thyself first  and after call in God. For to the worker God himself lends aid.
author: Euripides

quote: By night an atheist half-believes in God.
author: Edward Young

quote: Father expected a good deal of God. He didn't actually accuse God of inefficiency  but when he prayed his tone was loud and angry  like that of a dissatisfied guest in a carelessly managed hotel.
author: Clarence Day

quote: Lord  who art always the same  give that I know myself  give that I know Thee.
author: St. Augustine

quote: We have no choice but to be guilty God is unthinkable if we are innocent.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: Man appoints  and God disappoints.
author: Cervantes

quote: I am afraid I shall not find Him  but I shall still look for Him. If He exists  He may be appreciative of my efforts.
author: Jules Renard

quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things done.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: God is usually on the side of big squadrons and against little ones.
author: Roger de Bussy-Rabutin

quote: The more of himself man attributes to God  the less he has left in himself.
author: Karl Marx

quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: God is a comedian whose audience is afraid to laugh.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Every man thinks God is on his side. The rich and powerful know he is.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: I could prove God statistically.
author: George Gallup

quote: Man is a dog's ideal of what God should be.
author: Andri Malraux

quote: Christ - an anarchist who succeeded.
author: Axel Munthe

quote: An honest God is the noblest work of man.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: It is left only to God and to the angels to be lookers on.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God is really another artist. He invented the giraffe  the elephant and the cat. He has no real style. He just goes on trying other things.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The nearer the church  the further from God.
author: Bishop Lancelot Andrewes

quote: God'll send the bill to you.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I believe there is no god but Allah alone and Muhammed is his prophet.
author: Muslim Creed

quote: The world is more exacting than God himself.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Give God time.
author: The Koran

quote: God will be present  whether asked or not.
author: Latin proverb

quote: If God did not exist  it would be necessary to invent him.
author: Voltaire

quote: We trust  sir  that God is on our side. It is more important to know that we are on God's side.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The abdomen is the reason why man does not easily take himself for a god.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Beware of the man whose God is in the skies.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I can't believe that God plays dice with the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: One on God's side is a majority.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: If triangles had a God  he would have three sides.
author: Baron de Montesquieu

quote: God does not pay weekly  but he pays at the end.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: The finding of God is the coming to one's own self.
author: Meher Baba

quote: God moves in a mysterious way His wonders to perform  He plants his footsteps in the sea And rides upon the storm.
author: William Cowper

quote: Man proposes  God disposes.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: God doth not need Either man's work or his own gifts  who best Bear His mild yoke  they serve Him best  His state Is kingly  thousands at His bidding speed And post o'er land and ocean without rest - They also serve who only stand and wait.
author: John Milton

quote: If God made us in his image  we have certainly returned the compliment.
author: Voltaire

quote: God does not die on the day when we cease to believe in a personal deity  but we die on the day when our lives cease to be illuminated by the steady radiance  renewed daily  of a wonder  the source of which is beyond all reason.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: We know only that we are living in these bodies and have a vague idea  because we have heard it  and because our faith tells us so  that we possess souls. As to what good qualities there may be in our souls  or who dwells within them  or how precious they are  those are things which we seldom consider and so we trouble little about carefully preserving the soul's beauty.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: I believe in the incomprehensibility of God.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Every conjecture we can form with regard to the works of God has as little probability as the conjectures of a child with regard to the works of a man.
author: Thomas Reid

quote: God is incorporeal  divine  supreme  infinite. Mind  Spirit  Soul  Principle  Life  Truth  Love.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: No statement about God is simply  literally true. God is far more than can be measured  described  defined in ordinary language  or pinned down to any particular happening.
author: David Jenkins

quote: Who fathoms the Eternal Thought? Who talks of scheme and plan? The Lord is God! He needeth not The poor device of man.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Some people want to see God with their eyes as they see a cow  and to love Him as they love their cow-for the milk and cheese and profit it brings them. This is how it is with people who love God for the sake of outward wealth or inward comfort.
author: Meister Eckhart

quote: Your mind cannot possibly understand God. Your heart already knows. Minds were designed for carrying out the orders of the heart.
author: Emmanuel

quote: A comprehended God is no God at all.
author: Gerhard Tersteegen

quote: "What do you think of God " the teacher asked. After a pause  the young pupil replied  "He's not a think  he's a feel."
author: Paul Frost

quote: To them that ask  where have you seen the Gods  or how do you know for certain there are Gods  that you are so devout in their worship? I answer: Neither have I ever seen my own soul  and yet I respect and honor it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is the heart which experiences God  not the reason.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: I always say my God will take care of me. If it's my time I'll go  and if it's not I won't. I feel that He really has a lot of important things for me to do. And He's going to make sure that I'm here to do them.
author: Joycelyn Elders

quote: God is like a mirror. The mirror never changes  but everybody who looks at it sees something different.
author: Rabbi Harold Kushner

quote: God is to me that creative Force  behind and in the universe  who manifests Himself as energy  as life  as order  as beauty  as thought  as conscience  as love.
author: Henry Sloane Coffin

quote: God is incorporeal  divine  supreme  infinite. Mind  Spirit  Soul  Principle  Life  Truth  Love.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: God  that dumping ground of our dreams.
author: Jean Rostand

quote: The God of many men is little more than their court of appeal against the damnatory judgement passed on their failures by the opinion of the world.
author: William James

quote: God  to be God  must transcend what is. He must be the maker of what ought to be.
author: Rufus M. Jones

quote: God is an unutterable sigh  planted in the depths of the soul.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: God is a verb  not a noun.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: The most beautiful of all emblems is that of God  whom Timaeus of Locris describes under the image of "A circle whose centre is everywhere and whose circumference is nowhere."
author: Voltaire

quote: God is what man finds that is divine in himself. God is the best way man can behave in the ordinary occasions of life  and the farthest point to which man can stretch himself.
author: Max Lerner

quote: The deep emotional conviction of the presence of a superior reasoning power  which is revealed in the incomprehensible universe  forms my idea of God.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: God has many names  though He is only one Being.
author: Aristotle

quote: There is but one ultimate Power. This Power is to each one what he is to it.
author: Ernest Holmes

quote: It is impossible to fulfill the law concerning love for Me  God eternal  apart from the law concerning love for your neighbors.
author: Saint Catherine of Siena

quote: When we lose God  it is not God who is lost.
author: Anonymous

quote: If we're not growing  we must feel guilty  because we are not fulfilling Christ's demand.
author: Eva Burrows

quote: The soul can split the sky in two  and let the face of God shine through.
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The best thing must be to flee from all to the All.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: A humble knowledge of oneself is a surer road to God than a deep searching of the sciences.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: By learning to contact  listen to  and act on our intuition  we can directly connect to the higher power of the universe and allow it to become our guiding force.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: It's only by forgetting yourself that you draw near to God.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Some people talk about finding God  as if He could get lost.
author: Anonymous

quote: Hunting God is a great adventure.
author: Marie DeFloris

quote: In the faces of men and women I see God.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: To Be is to live with God.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nothing hath separated us from God but our own will  or rather our own will is our separation from God.
author: William Law

quote: The kingdom of God is within you.
author: Bible

quote: Not only then has each man his individual relation to God  but each man has his peculiar relation to God.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Because you cannot see him  God is everywhere.
author: Yasunari Kawabata

quote: All who call on God in true faith  earnestly from the heart  will certainly be heard  and will receive what they have asked and desired.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The light of God surrounds me  The love of God enfolds me  The power of God protects me  The Presence of God watches over me  Wherever I am  God is.
author: Prayer Card

quote: To think you are separate from God is to remain separate from your own being.
author: D. M. Street

quote: So great was my joy in God that I took no heed of looking at the angels and the saints  because all their goodness and all their beauty was from Him and in Him.
author: Saint Angela of Foligno

quote: Our condition is most noble  being so beloved of the Most High God that He was willing to die for our sake- which He would not have done if man had not been a most noble creature and of great worth.
author: Saint Angela of Foligno

quote: Our perfection certainly consists in knowing God and ourselves.
author: Saint Angela of Foligno

quote: In every out-thrust headland  in every curving beach  in every grain of sand  there is the story of the earth.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: Fo those leaning on the sustaining infinite  today is big with blessings.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Oh  if everyone knew how beautiful Jesus is  how amiable He is! Fhey would all die from love.
author: Gemma Galgani

quote: He loves  He hopes  He waits. Our Lord prefers to wait Himself for the sinner for years rather than keep us waiting an instant.
author: Maria Goretti

quote: Fhe Creator and Lord of all so loved the world  that He sent His Son for its salvation  the Prince and Savior of the faithful  who washed and dried our wounds  and from Him also came that most sweet medicine  from which all the good things of salvation flow.
author: Hildegard of Bingen

quote: Sometimes I try my hand at turning out small profundities and uncertain short stories  but I always end up with just one single word: God.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: Eventually I lost interest in trying to control my life  to make things happen in a way that I thought I wanted them to be. I began to practice surrendering to the universe and finding out what "it" wanted me to do.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: I would rather walk with God in the dark than go alone in the light.
author: Mary Gardiner Brainard

quote: Without the assistance of the Divine Being ... I cannot succeed. With that assistance  I cannot fail.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: For the rest of my life I'm going to trust that God is always at work in all things  and give Him thanks long before my simplest prayers are answered.
author: Nancy Parker Brummett

quote: Divine love always has met and always will meet every human need.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Jesus makes the bitterest mouthful taste sweet.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: The best remedy for those who are afraid  lonely  or unhappy is to go outside  somewhere where they can be quiet  alone with the heavens  nature  and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be and that God wishes to see people happy  amidst the simple beauty of nature. As long as this exists  and it certainly always will  I know that then there will always be comfort for every sorrow  whatever the circumstances may be. And I firmly believe that nature brings solace in all troubles.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Whoever falls from God's right hand is caught into His left.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: If I saw the gates of hell open and I stood on the brink of the abyss  I would not despair  I would not lose hope of mercy  because I would trust in You  my God.
author: Gemma Galgani

quote: The accidents of life separate us from our dearest friends  but let us not despair. God is like a looking glass in which souls see each other. The more we are united to Him by love  the nearer we are to those who belong to Him.
author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

quote: The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
author: Bible

quote: I will not fear  for you are ever with me  and you will never leave me to face my perils alone.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Pardon  not wrath  is God's best attribute.
author: Bayard Taylor

quote: Walk boldly and wisely. ... There is a hand above that will help you on.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: For the multitude of worldly friends profiteth not  nor may strong helpers anything avail  nor wise counselors give profitable counsel  nor the cunning of doctors give consolation  nor riches deliver in time of need  nor a secret place to defend  if Thou  Lord  do not assist  help  comfort  counsel  inform  and defend.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: The Blessed Virgin used me like a broom  and then put me back in my place.
author: Bernadette Soubirous

quote: Many a humble soul will be amazed to find that the seed it sowed in weakness  in the dust of daily life  has blossomed into immortal flowers under the eye of the Lord.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart  and lean not unto thine own understanding. In all thy ways acknowledge Him  and He shall direct thy paths.
author: Bible

quote: God speaks to all individuals through what happens to them moment by moment.
author: J. P. DeCaussade

quote: God uses lust to impel men to marry  ambition to office  avarice to earning  and fear to faith. God led me like an old blind goat.
author: Martin Luther

quote: An act of God was defined as "something which no reasonable man could have expected."
author: A. P. Herbert

quote: Let God love you through others and let God love others through you.
author: D. M. Street

quote: My debt to you  Beloved  Is one I cannot pay In any coin of any realm On any reckoning day.
author: Jessie Rittenhouse

quote: One unquestioned text we read  All doubt beyond  all fear above  Nor crackling pile nor cursing creed Can burn or blot it: God is Love.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: A true love of God must begin with a delight in his holiness.
author: Jonathan Edwards

quote: As to the aridity you are suffering from  it seems to me our Lord is treating you like someone He considers strong: He wants to test you and see if you love Him as much at times of aridity as when He sends you consolations. I think this is a very great favor for God to show you.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: The first condition of human goodness is something to love  the second  something to revere.
author: George Eliot

quote: No man hates God without first hating himself.
author: Fulton J. Sheen

quote: How is it  Lord  that we are cowards in everything save in opposing thee?
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: I have never understood why it should be considered derogatory to the Creator to suppose that He has a sense of humor.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Every law of matter or the body  supposed to govern man is rendered null and void by the law of Life  God.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Whom the heart of man shuts out  Sometimes the heart of God takes in.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I need nothing but God  and to lose myself in the heart of God.
author: Saint Margaret Mary Alacoque

quote: To love one that is great  is almost to be great one's self.
author: Madame Necker

quote: I would rather walk with God in the dark than go alone in the light.
author: Mary Gardiner Brainard

quote: What we are is God's gift to us. What we become is our gift to God.
author: Anonymous

quote: Gawd knows  and 'E won't split on a pal.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Holy church-that mother who is also a queen because she is a king's bride.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: "You are accepted!" ... accepted by that which is greater than you and the name of which you do not know. Do not ask the name now  perhaps you will know it later. Do not try to do anything  perhaps later you will do much. Do not seek for anything  do not perform anything  do not intend anything. Simply accept the fact that you are accepted.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: As in heaven Your will is punctually performed  so may it be done on earth by all creatures  particularly in me and by me.
author: Saint Elizabeth of Hungary

quote: Christ has made my soul beautiful with the jewels of grace and virtue.
author: Saint Agnes

quote: God delays  but doesn't forget.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: How is it  Lord  that we are cowards in everything save in opposing Thee?
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: God is clever  but not dishonest.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Yet  in the maddening maze of things  And tossed by storm and flood  To one fixed trust my spirit clings  I know that God is good!
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: I could be whatever I wanted to be if I trusted that music  that song  that vibration of God that was inside of me.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: The million little things that drop into your hands The small opportunities each day brings He leaves us free to use or abuse And goes unchanging along His silent way.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The Father most tender  Father of all  my immense God-I His atom.
author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

quote: What is there in man so worthy of honor and reverence as this  that he is capable of contemplating something higher than his own reason  more sublime than the whole universe- that Spirit which alone is self-subsis-tent  from which all truth proceeds  without which there is no truth?
author: Friedrich Jacobi

quote: I thank the goodness and the grace Which on my birth have smiled  And made me  in these Christian days  A happy Christian child.
author: Jane Taylor

quote: A consciousness of God releases the greatest power of all.
author: Ernest Holmes

quote: Above all am I convinced of the need  irrevocable and inescapable  of every human heart  for God. No matter how we try to escape  to lose ourselves in restless seeking  we cannot separate ourselves from our divine source. There is no substitute for God.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: Talking about God is not at all the same thing as experiencing God  or acting out God through our lives.
author: Phillip Hewett

quote: The person who has a firm trust in the Supreme Being is powerful in his power  wise by his wisdom  happy by his happiness.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: God has not promised skies always blue  flower-strewn pathways all our lives through  God has not promised sun without rain  joy without sorrow  peace without pain. But God has promised strength for the day  rest for the labor  light for the way  Grace for the trials  help from above  unfailing sympathy  undying love.
author: Annie Johnson Flint

quote: Courage is not afraid to weep  and she is not afraid to pray  even when she is not sure who she is praying to.
author: J. Ruth Gendler

quote: God is no enemy to you. He asks no more than that He hear you call Him "Friend."
author: Anonymous

quote: Deep down in every man  woman and child  is the fundamental idea of God. It may be obscured by calamity  by pomp  by worship of other things  but in some form or other it is there. For faith in a Power greater than ourselves  and miraculous demonstrations of that power in human lives  are facts as old as man himself.
author: Alcoholics Anonymous

quote: Our human resources  as marshalled by the will  were not sufficient  they failed utterly.... Every day is a day when we must carry the vision of God's will into all our activities.
author: Alcoholics Anonymous

quote: Then comes the insight that All is God. One still realizes that the world is as it was  but it does not matter  it does not affect one's faith.
author: Abraham Heschel

quote: The experience of God  or in any case the possibility of experiencing God  is innate.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Before me  even as behind  God is  and all is well.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Forgetfulness of self is remembrance of God.
author: Bayazid Al-Bistami

quote: Every morning I spend fifteen minutes filling my mind full of God  and so there's no room left for worry thoughts.
author: Howard Chandler Christy

quote: Darkness is strong  and so is Sin  But surely God endures forever!
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I need nothing but God  and to lose myself in the heart of God.
author: Saint Margaret Mary Alacoque

quote: It is not my ability  but my response to God's ability  that counts.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: He is more within us than we are ourselves.
author: Elizabeth Ann Seton

quote: We have grasped the mystery of the atom and rejected the Sermon on the Mount.
author: General Omar N. Bradley

quote: The Ethiop gods have Ethiop lips  Bronze cheeks  and woolly hair  The Grecian gods are like the Greeks  As keen-eyed  cold and fair.
author: Walter Bageh

quote: There's a one-eyed yellow idol to the north of Khat-mandu  There's a little marble cross below the town  There's a broken-hearted woman tends the grave of Mad Carew  And die yellow god forever gazes down.
author: J. Milton Hayes

quote: Yet verily these issues lie on the lap of the gods.
author: Homer

quote: You shall not press down upon the brow of labor this crown of thorns - you shall not crucify mankind upon a cross of gold!
author: W. J. Bryan

quote: Gold begets in brethren hate  Gold in families debate  Gold does friendship separate  Gold does civil wars create.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Gold! Gold! Gold! Gold! Bright and yellow  hard and cold
author: Thomas Hood

quote: Accursed thirst for gold! what dost thou not compel mortals to do?
author: Virgil

quote: What you do not want others to do to you  do not do to others.
author: Confucius

quote: What thou thyself hatest  do to no man.
author: Apocrypha Tobit

quote: Do unto the other feller the way he'd like to do unto you an' do it fust.
author: Edward N. Westcott

quote: Whatsoever thou wouldst that men should not do to thee  do not do that to them.
author: Hillel Ha-Babli

quote: As ye would that men should do to you  do ye also to them likewise.
author: Bible

quote: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory  let us now commit it to life.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: All things whatsoever ye wou'd that men should do to you  do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
author: Matthew

quote: Do not do unto others as you would that they should do unto you. Their tastes may not be the same.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Good-humor makes all things tolerable.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The sunshine of the mind.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Good-humor is goodness and wisdom combined.
author: Owen Meredith

quote: Bad is never good until worse happens.
author: Danish proverb

quote: Good and evil lie close together. Seek no artistic unity in character.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Gifts are hooks.
author: Martial

quote: Good things  when short  are twice as good.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: If I can in any way contribute to the Diversion or Improvement of the Country in which I live  I shall leave it  when I am summoned out of it  with the secret Satisfaction of thinking that I have not lived in vain.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: In nature  nothing can be given  all things are sold.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Teach us to give and not to count the cost.
author: Ignatius Loyola

quote: The meaning of good and bad  of better and worse  is simply helping or hurting.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Too long a sacrifice Can make a stone of the heart.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Unto whomsoever much is given  of him shall much be required.
author: Bible
